dialogue_en: Hm... You seem tense. Might wanna stretch─loosen up a little.
dialogue_jp: う～ん　すこし動きが硬かったかな？

dialogue_en: That match really got my blood pumpin'.
dialogue_jp: いい刺激になったよ　ありがとう

dialogue_en: Yeah! Nobody's better than my muscle mentor!
dialogue_jp: くう～　師匠はやっぱりすごいな～！

dialogue_en: Your abs are a work of art! A sculpture of flesh!
dialogue_jp: 師匠の腹筋　思わず見とれちゃいました！

dialogue_en: Hot damn, girl! That was a whoopin' I won't forget.
dialogue_jp: ビューティフル！　オレの負けだ

dialogue_en: Whew! Looks like I've met my muscle match.
dialogue_jp: エクセレント！　おそれいったよ

dialogue_en: Grr... I gotta train even harder. Get super swole!
dialogue_jp: ぐぬぬ　この悔しさを筋トレにぶつけるぞ！

dialogue_en: No way! My muscles failed me!
dialogue_jp:
ぬおお……
なぜだ　なぜ勝てない！

dialogue_en: That was easy.
dialogue_jp: おだてに乗るな

dialogue_en: Hehe... Our guy's as good as found!
dialogue_jp: へへへ　まかせてよ！

dialogue_en: Well, I can't argue with you there.
dialogue_jp: まあ　そうだろうな

dialogue_en: Who better to hunt down a criminal than someone who's got a nose for trackin'─one finer than any human could ever possess.
dialogue_jp:
中でも　いかにもききそうなその鼻があれば
犯人の行方など　すぐにわかるだろう

dialogue_en: Or the right merc's friend, to be more precise.
dialogue_jp: 人間など足もとにも及ばない　その五感

dialogue_en:
Only option is to save the man myself...
or hire the right merc to save him for me.
dialogue_jp:
そこでだ　おまえさんらに
黒マントの救出を依頼したい

dialogue_en: Haaah...
dialogue_jp: ううん

dialogue_en: Hmm...
dialogue_jp: いや

dialogue_en:
Look at this place.
Can barely afford bandages, never mind a ransom.
dialogue_jp: さびれた診療所に　身代金が払えると思うか？

dialogue_en: You gonna pay up?
dialogue_jp: どうするつもりだ

dialogue_en: Beats the hell outta me. Guess some fool got it in their head I was makin' money off my research.
dialogue_jp:
わしが　黒マントを研究しているのを知って
金になると誤解したらしい

dialogue_en: What's this?
dialogue_jp: ゆーかい？

dialogue_en: What's this?
dialogue_jp: 誘拐？

dialogue_en: "Agree to the terms, and we'll take care of the rest."
dialogue_jp: 『受け渡し方法は　おって連絡する』

dialogue_en: "We have one of your robed men. If you want him back, it will cost you one million gil.
dialogue_jp:
『黒マントの男は預かった
　返してほしくば　１万ギル用意しろ』

dialogue_en:
Glad you're here, in any case. I got a situation.
See for yourself.
dialogue_jp:
実は　厄介なことになってな
この手紙を見てくれ

dialogue_en: Hey, lemme give that letter a sniff.
dialogue_jp: クラウド　その手紙　嗅がせて

dialogue_en: Cloud. The letter, if you don't mind?
dialogue_jp: クラウド　その手紙を私の鼻先に

dialogue_en: Not like I can give you a name or next of kin neither. Could try to question the others, but...we both know how that'd go.
dialogue_jp:
名前も家も　身内がいるかもわからん
黒マントから辿るのは　難しいだろうな

dialogue_en: Curious about the guy who got nabbed? Well, what is there to say? I mean, their most notable traits ain't exactly unique.
dialogue_jp:
ほかの黒マントと変わらんよ
意識は混濁し　簡単な会話もできない

dialogue_en: Well, I'm glad one of us is enjoying this.
dialogue_jp: あんた　楽しんでないか？

dialogue_en: But hey, you're the detective.
dialogue_jp: なにも　わからんと思うね

dialogue_en: What you see is what you get. No hidden codes, ciphers─nothin'.
dialogue_jp:
ただの手紙だ
あぶってもこすっても　隠しメッセージはナシ

dialogue_en: Y'know, could be that the perpetrator threw on a hood to blend in. Doubt anyone'd bat so much as an eyelash at one more robe walkin' around.
dialogue_jp:
思うに　犯人は黒マントに変装したのだろう
そうすれば　ここじゃだれも気に留めんからな

dialogue_en: Spoke with some of the neighbors, but they weren't much help. No one saw anythin' outta the ordinary.
dialogue_jp:
ふむ　聞いてまわったが
誰も犯人らしき者は見ていない

dialogue_en: So where should we start?
dialogue_jp: なにから調べよっか

dialogue_en: So where do we start?
dialogue_jp: まずはどうする

dialogue_en: Though there are a number of competing smells through which I must sift.
dialogue_jp:
さらに　混ざってしまったノイズを
選り分けることも必要だ

dialogue_en: I can pick up a person's body odor in a snap, to say nothing of someone's cologne.
dialogue_jp:
香水のニオイは　もちろんだけど
犯人自身のニオイもあるからね

dialogue_en: A single sniff of a person's clothing is enough for me to locate them.
dialogue_jp:
まとっている衣服のニオイなどを分析し
立体的に組み立てる

dialogue_en: Bodily secretions are as distinct as any perfume.
dialogue_jp: キーとなる香水だけでなく　汗や体臭

dialogue_en: Oh yeah. Pretty easily, actually!
dialogue_jp: まあね　バッチリわかるよ

dialogue_en: My olfactory sense is seven thousand times more sensitive than yours.
dialogue_jp: 我が一族の嗅覚は　ヒトの７千倍と言われている

dialogue_en: You can actually smell them?
dialogue_jp: ニオイは　はっきりわかるのか

dialogue_en: Just follow me, okay?
dialogue_jp: クラウド　行こう

dialogue_en: Follow me, Cloud.
dialogue_jp: クラウド　行くぞ

dialogue_en:
Y'all seem to have a soft spot for these men.
Mind doin' one a good turn?
dialogue_jp:
黒マントとは　縁があるんだろ
助けてやってくれ

dialogue_en: Kidnapper must not be the sharpest tool in the shed if they think I got money...
dialogue_jp: 誘拐するなら　もっと金持ちを狙えばいいものを

dialogue_en: There's a compound in our robed friends' sweat that glows when exposed to this light. Just hope it helps some.
dialogue_jp:
黒マントの体液にだけ反応するライトだ
捜索の役に立つかもしれない

dialogue_en:
How about that─picked up the trail already!
Ah, which reminds me...
dialogue_jp:
ほう　頼もしいな
おっと　そうだ

dialogue_en:
I'm getting a pretty interesting scent...
Some kind of cologne?
dialogue_jp:
ちょっと　いいニオイがする
香水かな？

dialogue_en:
There's a strong scent, but...
Cologne, perhaps?
dialogue_jp:
これは　香水か？
特徴的なかおりが残っている

dialogue_en:
Their scent seems to lead straight ahead, but...
Oh, that's not good.
dialogue_jp:
犯人のニオイは
あそこに続いているようだが……まずいな

dialogue_en: Okay, got their scent. I'll take it from here.
dialogue_jp: ニオイはバッチリ　オイラにまかせて！

dialogue_en: Think they're this way.
dialogue_jp: ニオイは　こっちみたい

dialogue_en: It's time we resumed our search.
dialogue_jp: ニオイの追跡を再開する

dialogue_en: I believe I've picked up their scent.
dialogue_jp: ニオイは　この先へ続いているようだ

dialogue_en: Cloud, we were tracking some black robe, right?
dialogue_jp: クラウド　追跡の途中だったよね

dialogue_en: They're really makin' us work for it. Let's go!
dialogue_jp: クラウド　覚えてる？

dialogue_en: If I may... Don't forget we have unfinished business.
dialogue_jp:
クラウド
仕事が途中だ　続けるぞ

dialogue_en: Now's the time for any unfinished business.
dialogue_jp: クラウド　覚えているか？

dialogue_en: I mean, I wouldn't go that far...
dialogue_jp: 気にしない　気にしない

dialogue_en: Not literal "shit," no...
dialogue_jp: 気にするな　私にしかわからない

dialogue_en: Like blood and shit, then.
dialogue_jp: あまり　良さそうじゃないな

dialogue_en:
Like...a guy who's seen his fair share of battles,
I guess.
dialogue_jp: う～ん　戦う青年のニオイかな

dialogue_en:
Like a man who's killed his fair share of fiends,
I suppose.
dialogue_jp:
モンスターを斬り刻んできた
青年のニオイだな

dialogue_en: Huh... What do I smell like?
dialogue_jp: 俺は　どんなニオイがするんだ？

dialogue_en: And I can hone in on any scent I want, even if there are lots of other strong ones.
dialogue_jp:
ほかにも　いろんなニオイが混ざってるけど
ちゃんと嗅ぎ分けられるんだよ

dialogue_en: Whoa, easy there. I can spare a bite!
dialogue_jp: うそうそ　すこしだけだよ？

dialogue_en: Sorry, but this is people food.
dialogue_jp: 残念　あげないよ

dialogue_en: Aw...you must be hungry, huh?
dialogue_jp: もしかして　お腹が空いてる？

dialogue_en: Definitely not a kidnapper. My nose can tell.
dialogue_jp: この人からは　犯人のニオイはしないよ

dialogue_en:
Different scent.
He has nothing to do with the kidnapping.
dialogue_jp: ニオイが違う　この男は犯人ではない

dialogue_en: Oh, hello there!
dialogue_jp: うん　どうしたの？

dialogue_en: Smells like trouble, guys!
dialogue_jp: 強敵のニオイだよ！

dialogue_en: Ready!?
dialogue_jp: 来るぞ！

dialogue_en: It's nothing... Let's just check it out.
dialogue_jp: ううん　とにかく行ってみよ

dialogue_en: Nothing... Let's continue.
dialogue_jp: いや　ひとまず向かおう

dialogue_en: What?
dialogue_jp: どうした？

dialogue_en:
Well, their scent leads straight there, but...
Ah man, why now?
dialogue_jp:
犯人は　あそこへ向かったみたいなんだけど
困ったなあ

dialogue_en: Because I'm not you─I'm me.
dialogue_jp: わたしは　わたしだから

dialogue_en: And no matter how much I want to follow in your footsteps and make you proud...I can't.
dialogue_jp:
おばあちゃんが求めるスラムエンジェルには
なれないし　ならない

dialogue_en: but that's your thing, Grandma─not mine.
dialogue_jp:
でも　わたしは
おばあちゃんじゃない

dialogue_en:
I've always looked up to the Guardian Angel
of the Slums...
dialogue_jp:
わたし　ずっとスラムエンジェルに
あこがれてた

dialogue_en: And that really, really sucks, y'know.
dialogue_jp: それって　すっごくムカつく

dialogue_en: Parents want kids to listen to them 'cause they "know what's best," but they don't. They just want us to do whatever they tell us.
dialogue_jp:
大人って　よく子供のためって言うけど
結局　自分の思いどおりにしたいだけなんだよね

dialogue_en: Honestly? I kinda get where Kyrie is coming from here.
dialogue_jp: アタシは　キリエの気持ち　わかるよ

dialogue_en:
And if you're to be the next
Guardian Angel of the Slums...
dialogue_jp:
ゆくゆくは
スラムエンジェルの後継者にしようと

dialogue_en: Kyrie... You know I only want what's best for you.
dialogue_jp:
キリエ　アタシは
アンタのことを思って言ってんのさ

dialogue_en: No matter what I try, every single time it's, "I wouldn't do that if I were you"!
dialogue_jp:
わたしを子供扱いして
やることなすこと　否定しないと気がすまないの

dialogue_en: You're the one who doesn't get it!
dialogue_jp: おばあちゃんは　いつもそう

dialogue_en:
Look, I'm doing my best out here, okay!?
It's just that some things are beyond my control.
dialogue_jp:
わたしなりに　精一杯やってるの！
そりゃ　うまくいかない時もあるけど

dialogue_en:
Make it a thousand and one,
'cause you still don't get it!
dialogue_jp: わかってないよ　全然わかってない

dialogue_en: I heard that.
dialogue_jp: 笑ったな

dialogue_en: And since I can't get the smell of meat outta my nostrils, I...I don't think I'm gonna be a ton of help right now.
dialogue_jp:
いまも　お肉のニオイで頭がいっぱい
しばらくオイラの鼻には期待しないで

dialogue_en:
With this overpowering aroma of meat in the air,
I don't think I'll be able to focus on the kidnapper's scent.
dialogue_jp:
いまもまだ　漂う肉のかおりに引っ張られている
しばらく私の鼻には期待しないでくれ

dialogue_en:
Whenever I catch a whiff of food,
it's all I can think about.
dialogue_jp: 食べ物のニオイに　すっごく弱いんだよね

dialogue_en: My appetite.
dialogue_jp: 食欲に負ける

dialogue_en: What?
dialogue_jp: なんだ

dialogue_en:
There's, uh, something you should
know about me and my nose.
dialogue_jp: あのね　オイラの鼻なんだけど

dialogue_en:
Though I am a skilled tracker,
I have one terrible weakness.
dialogue_jp:
実は　私の鼻にも
ひとつだけ弱点がある

dialogue_en: Now this is what I call a perfectly cooked slab of meat...! Oh no─you already got your bit.
dialogue_jp:
よし　いい感じに焼けてきたな
もうあげないよ

dialogue_en: I'd rather relax in the great outdoors than some hoity-toity beach resort.
dialogue_jp:
コスタでバカンスより　こうやって
ひとりでキャンプのほうが好きなんだ

dialogue_en: Hm, now that you mention it... There was this one hooded fella. With a chocobo carriage─headed toward a cave nearby.
dialogue_jp:
う～ん　そういえばそんな格好をしたやつが
チョコボ車で洞窟のほうへ行くのを見たな

dialogue_en: See a guy in a black robe come through?
dialogue_jp: 黒いマントを着た男を見なかったか？

dialogue_en: You mean...?
dialogue_jp: どうする？

dialogue_en: You mean...?
dialogue_jp: やるか

dialogue_en:
Well, Sheiran asked us to rescue his patient.
He didn't say anything about how we should deal with the kidnapper.
dialogue_jp:
黒マントを連れ戻せ　それがシロンの依頼だ
犯人のことは　なにも言っていなかった

dialogue_en:
So if we find our guy...
whadda you wanna do about the culprit?
dialogue_jp:
黒マント　いるかなあ？
犯人もいっしょかな

dialogue_en:
Once we've found our man,
what should we do with his captor?
dialogue_jp: 黒マントを見つけたとして　犯人はどうする？

dialogue_en: Maybe we oughta try the light Doc Sheiran gave us!
dialogue_jp: シロン先生にもらったライトを使ってみたら？

dialogue_en: Time to put the doctor's light to use.
dialogue_jp: シロンにもらったライトを使ってみてはどうだ

dialogue_en: They gotta be close.
dialogue_jp: 誘拐犯を探そう

dialogue_en: Cloud, look.
dialogue_jp: クラウド　見て

dialogue_en: Cloud, look.
dialogue_jp: クラウド　見ろ

dialogue_en: Kweh kweh! Kwehhh!
dialogue_jp: クエクエッ　クエ～！

dialogue_en: Kweh! Kweh!
dialogue_jp: クエックエ～！

dialogue_en:
Grilled meat is all it takes to throw
you off your game?
dialogue_jp: ナナキから逃げる時は肉を焼こう

dialogue_en:
Grilled meat is all it takes to throw
you off your game?
dialogue_jp: レッドをまくには肉を焼けか

dialogue_en: Hey!
dialogue_jp: 笑った？

dialogue_en: Urg...ah... Hrn...
dialogue_jp: うう……うう……

dialogue_en: Urg...ah... Hrn...
dialogue_jp: うう……うう……

dialogue_en: Urg...ah... Hrn...
dialogue_jp: うう……ああ……

dialogue_en: Urg...ah... Hrn...
dialogue_jp: うう……ああ……

dialogue_en:
Some crazy bastard kidnapped us
and stuck us in this cave.
dialogue_jp:
わたしたち　誘拐されて
監禁されてるの

dialogue_en: Help!
dialogue_jp: 助けて！

dialogue_en: Could hide till they get back─catch 'em by surprise?
dialogue_jp: 戻ってくるまで　どこかに隠れて待つ？

dialogue_en: So? Do we wait?
dialogue_jp: どうする　待つか？

dialogue_en: Place reeks of kidnapper. No sign of 'em, though.
dialogue_jp: 犯人のすみかみたいだね　いないけど

dialogue_en: This is the kidnapper's camp. No sign of them...
dialogue_jp: 犯人の根城だ　留守のようだな

dialogue_en: Copy.
dialogue_jp: りょーかい！

dialogue_en: Understood.
dialogue_jp: 承知した

dialogue_en: We'll figure it out later.
dialogue_jp: 犯人の出方を見て　決めよう

dialogue_en: Aren't you a clever little puppy, sniffing out the truth.
dialogue_jp: この変装を見破るなんて　賢いワンちゃんね

dialogue_en: Aw, boo.
dialogue_jp: バレちまったか

dialogue_en: Shit.
dialogue_jp: クラウド

dialogue_en:
This smell...
Cloud─they're the ones we're looking for!
dialogue_jp:
このニオイ
クラウド　そいつらが犯人だよ！

dialogue_en: This smell... Cloud. It's them!
dialogue_jp:
このニオイ
クラウド　そいつらが犯人だ！

dialogue_en:
Excuse me? I'm suspicious?
Or the robed guy? Who?
dialogue_jp:
えっ　どういうことですか
わたし？　この黒マント？

dialogue_en: The kidnapper could be anywhere...or anyone.
dialogue_jp: もしかしたら　すごく近くにいたりして

dialogue_en:
Huh? Why would we know anything?
We were too freaked out to even look at him.
dialogue_jp: わかりません　わたし必死に逃げてきて

dialogue_en: you shit-for-brains.
dialogue_jp: あなたがマヌケで

dialogue_en:
Oh, thank you so much!
What ever would we have done without you...
dialogue_jp:
ありがとうございます
本当に助かります

dialogue_en: Yeah, yeah, you've told me a thousand times!
dialogue_jp: ハイハイ　わかってるよ！

dialogue_en: He's as wicked as they come. You need to pick your targets with care.
dialogue_jp:
あれほど言っただろ
カモにする相手はしっかり選びなって

dialogue_en: Don't be fooled: that mayor's no model citizen.
dialogue_jp: 市長は　ああ見えて百戦錬磨の性悪だ

dialogue_en:
If Cloud hadn't come to your rescue, young lady,
you would've been a goner!
dialogue_jp:
来たのがクラウドじゃなかったら
アンタ　死んでたよ

dialogue_en: Figured I'd pay 'em a visit and, well...
dialogue_jp: 挨拶しようと思ったら　これだ

dialogue_en:
I was taking some time off to enjoy the sun,
when I heard a "merc" was in town.
dialogue_jp:
太陽と海を満喫しようと来てみたら
なんでも屋がいるって言うじゃないか

dialogue_en: Grandma!?
dialogue_jp: おばあちゃん！

dialogue_en:
Forgive my granddaughter her questionable
sense of humor.
dialogue_jp: そのへんで許してやっておくれよ　なんでも屋

dialogue_en: Do you wanna die?
dialogue_jp: 俺をなめてるのか

dialogue_en: Or was it that I pressured you into doing all the dirty work? Or that I wasn't giving you a big enough cut?
dialogue_jp:
それとも　仕事を押しつけちゃったこと？
それとも　取り分すくない？

dialogue_en: Wha!?
dialogue_jp: って　ああ？

dialogue_en: Hear that? Give us the money or we're gonna─
dialogue_jp: もし返して欲しければ　金を……

dialogue_en: Now? Now nothin'. Dog or no dog, they're never gonna be able to find that dude without us.
dialogue_jp:
落ちつけ　エリー
黒マントは俺たちしかわからない所に隠してある

dialogue_en: Ah, shit. Now what?
dialogue_jp: バロウ　どうする？

dialogue_en: Give us the guy or you're next.
dialogue_jp: 黒マントの男を返せ

dialogue_en: Huh. That's some mighty fine killin'.
dialogue_jp: へえ　やるじゃねえか

dialogue_en: I wonder what your friends would've paid for you. Guess we'll never know!
dialogue_jp:
うふふ　あなたを誘拐したら
身代金はいくらかしら

dialogue_en: Barry the Brash!
dialogue_jp: バロウ様だぞ

dialogue_en: Ellie the Elusive!
dialogue_jp: エリー　ア～ンド！

dialogue_en:
We're not your average criminals, kid.
In fact, we're the world's greatest double act!
dialogue_jp:
俺たちを誰だと思ってる
泣く子も黙る　クレイジーカップル

dialogue_en: Think we'd just tell you?
dialogue_jp: 教えるわけないだろ

dialogue_en: Okay. Where is he?
dialogue_jp: 誘拐した黒マントは　どこだ？

dialogue_en: Suck it, losers!
dialogue_jp: バ～イ！

dialogue_en: Stay a while! Sure ya got lots to catch up on!
dialogue_jp: お仲間同士　仲良くしてな！

dialogue_en: Even the strongest ones don't stay strong for long. Sooner or later, he'll wind up like all the rest─another mumbling, hooded freak.
dialogue_jp:
黒マントってのは　ソルジャーの成れの果て
劣化したソルジャーなんだろ？

dialogue_en: No wonder he wiped the floor with that monster... But time ain't on his side.
dialogue_jp:
どうりで強いはずだぜ
でも　聞いたぞ

dialogue_en: He's a SOLDIER.
dialogue_jp: ソルジャーだよ

dialogue_en: Barry, look. The kid's eyes.
dialogue_jp: ねえバロウ　あいつの目　見た？

dialogue_en: What? Old buddy of yours?
dialogue_jp: なんだ　知り合いか？

dialogue_en: Re...union...
dialogue_jp: ああ……リユ……オン……

dialogue_en: I knew we should have tied him up!
dialogue_jp: ずっとおとなしかったのに　どうして

dialogue_en: Hey! We told you to stay put!
dialogue_jp: おい　勝手に出てくんじゃねえ！

dialogue_en:
Lemme guess: are you mad that
I called myself a mercenary?
dialogue_jp:
もしかして
なんでも屋を名乗ったことを怒ってる？

dialogue_en: No, wait!
dialogue_jp: まっ　待って！

dialogue_en: That's the best you can come up with?
dialogue_jp: それが答えでいいのか

dialogue_en: I'm so gorgeous that you can't take your eyes off me─distracting you from your mercenary duties, right?
dialogue_jp:
わたしが近くにいると　ドキドキして
なにも手につかなくなる　とか？

dialogue_en:
Oh god, I dunno...
Wait a minute─is this about my looks?
dialogue_jp:
えっ　なんだろ
もしかして……可愛いすぎるから？

dialogue_en: I mean...I would've figured something out. I'm actually a surprisingly resourceful gal, y'know?
dialogue_jp:
まあ　臨機応変？
こう見えても　ウラオモテ　経験してるから

dialogue_en: And if I hadn't shown up? What then?
dialogue_jp: 俺が来なかったら　どうする気だった

dialogue_en: Well...once you showed up, I knew you'd handle it better than me, so I thought I should let the pro do his thing.
dialogue_jp:
それは　クラウドが来てくれたから
頼っちゃったっていうか　甘えちゃったっていうか

dialogue_en: Okay, okay! Fine! I won't call myself a merc anymore. But...the mayor does technically owe me for this job, so...
dialogue_jp:
わかった　もう名乗らないから！
だから　ねっ　おねが～い

dialogue_en: Or ask me to clean up your mess.
dialogue_jp: 迷惑だと　何度も言ったはずだ

dialogue_en:
But...if I didn't call myself a merc,
no one would ask me for help!
dialogue_jp: ほら　まずはカタチからって言うじゃない

dialogue_en: In name only, maybe.
dialogue_jp: 名前をかたれば　なれるのか

dialogue_en: I just...I just wanted to be like you, that's all!
dialogue_jp: わたしも　クラウドみたいになりたかったんだよ！

dialogue_en: Well, y'see, when you helped me back in Midgar, I thought "Wow, that guy's so cool, I wanna do what he does."
dialogue_jp:
それは　ミッドガルで助けてもらって
いい仕事だな～　かっこいいな～と思って

dialogue_en: So much so, I doubt anyone in the company knew what the long-term effects might be...
dialogue_jp:
加齢　経年によるソルジャーの変化は
神羅だって知らんだろう

dialogue_en: The procedure you boys underwent was cutting edge.
dialogue_jp: ソルジャーは比較的新しい技術だから

dialogue_en: Not really.
dialogue_jp: 問題ない

dialogue_en: Been feelin' under the weather?
dialogue_jp: 自覚や兆候があるのか？

dialogue_en:
If anyone here was gonna have answers,
it'd be you, son.
dialogue_jp: だからむしろ　わしのほうが聞きたい

dialogue_en: Only doctors with access to those secrets are the company's own. I certainly don't qualify.
dialogue_jp:
神羅以外の医師が　ソルジャーを診察する機会も
そうそうあるもんじゃない

dialogue_en:
But Shinra keeps a tight lid on
everything SOLDIER-related.
dialogue_jp:
ソルジャーの情報は
ほとんど公開されておらんし

dialogue_en: Believe me; if I knew, I'd tell ya.
dialogue_jp: 正直なところ　わからん

dialogue_en: Is SOLDIER degradation real?
dialogue_jp: ソルジャーが劣化するって　本当なの？

dialogue_en: Is it true that SOLDIERs' cells degrade?
dialogue_jp: ソルジャーが劣化するというのは　本当なのか？

dialogue_en:
And save for a few scrapes,
none the worse for the wear.
dialogue_jp: 多少傷が増えているが　問題ないだろう

dialogue_en: Glad to see our man's still alive.
dialogue_jp: ご苦労さん　助かったよ

dialogue_en: Let's take him back to Sheiran.
dialogue_jp: シロンのところへ帰ろう

dialogue_en: Let 'em go. We got our man.
dialogue_jp: 追うな　目的は果たした

dialogue_en: You kids need some help?
dialogue_jp: なんか　困ってんのか？

dialogue_en: Probably why they haven't come around lookin' for new recruits. Know better than to waste their time with us.
dialogue_jp:
反神羅連絡会とかいう組織も
さすがに　この村は勧誘せんだろうな

dialogue_en: Gotta hand it to the SRC, though: no one around these parts has the guts to stand up to Shinra.
dialogue_jp:
まあ　神羅に抗おうなんて気合いの入ったヤツは
この村にはおらんがな

dialogue_en: That was a wild statement outta Wutai.
dialogue_jp: ウータイの放送の話を聞いたよ

dialogue_en:
Still waiting on a SOLDIER sample,
if you catch my drift.
dialogue_jp: 黒マントとソルジャーの血を比較したいんだがな

dialogue_en: Blood won't draw itself─and given the sheer number of those robes, collecting samples'll take time.
dialogue_jp:
黒マントは確実に増えている
いまのうちにデータだけでもそろえておかんとな

dialogue_en: Well. I reckon I'd better get back to work.
dialogue_jp: さ～て　採血を再開するかな

dialogue_en: Hehehe! Well, one of these days I'll win ya over!
dialogue_jp:
はははは　まあ
気長に待つことにするよ

dialogue_en: No.
dialogue_jp: 断る

dialogue_en: So...change your mind about that blood sample?
dialogue_jp: やっぱり　血を採らしてくれんか

dialogue_en: The more information we have, the better.
dialogue_jp: よって　どんな情報も貴重だ

dialogue_en: Well? What's the problem?
dialogue_jp: それで　なにがあったんだ

dialogue_en: You can pick up their tab.
dialogue_jp: あんたが立て替えるんだ

dialogue_en: You chargin' kids now?
dialogue_jp: 子供から取る気か

dialogue_en: News to me.
dialogue_jp: 覚えておこう

dialogue_en: 'Course I'm soft on kids. Helpin' 'em's what we do.
dialogue_jp: 子供に優しくすんのが　大人の役目だ

dialogue_en: Whatever.
dialogue_jp: 雑にまとめるな

dialogue_en: Don't get all bent outta shape. 'Sides, I'll always be older than you.
dialogue_jp:
こまけぇなあ
オレがおじさんなら　おまえもおじさんだ

dialogue_en: He's tough─tougher than he looks─and real good at solvin' people's problems. Right?
dialogue_jp:
こう見えて強いんだ
なんでも解決してくれるぜ　なあ？

dialogue_en: Oh, is that so... Well then, why don't you talk to this old fella instead?
dialogue_jp:
ああ……そうか
じゃあよ　このおじさんに話してみろ

dialogue_en: Mommy said I'm not s'posed to talk to you.
dialogue_jp: おじさんとは　口をきいちゃダメなの

dialogue_en: What?
dialogue_jp: あん？

dialogue_en: Oh, and my mommy told me you can craft 'em yourself if you've got the right chip.
dialogue_jp:
ワナになるバードトラップは
アイテムクラフトで作れるよ

dialogue_en: He said those are good places to set traps!
dialogue_jp: そこにワナを仕掛けるといいって言ってた

dialogue_en: Great! Grandpa said there's some old birdhouses out in the desert that people built back in the republic days.
dialogue_jp:
じぃじが言うには　共和国時代に使ってた鳥小屋が
砂漠にいくつか残ってるんだって

dialogue_en: Promise.
dialogue_jp: おうよ

dialogue_en: Really?
dialogue_jp: ほんと？

dialogue_en: You just leave it to us. We'll find your friend.
dialogue_jp: おじさんたちにまかせろ　見つけてやる

dialogue_en: What!? But we aren't allowed to go all the way out there.
dialogue_jp: ええ　砂漠？　どうしよう……

dialogue_en: You guys! Grandpa said he saw Mr. Birdie heading toward the desert!
dialogue_jp:
みんな　ピヨが砂漠のほうに行ったって
じぃじが見たんだ

dialogue_en: No way!
dialogue_jp: そうだったんだ

dialogue_en: Your bird friend. He had a run-in with a nasty fiend, and we saved his tiny behind.
dialogue_jp:
その鳥の名前だ
モンスターに襲われていたのを助けたんだ

dialogue_en: Who's that?
dialogue_jp: クラピヨ？

dialogue_en: "Pointy," huh? I bet they're talkin' about Cloud Jr.
dialogue_jp: それって　クラピヨのことじゃねえか？

dialogue_en: His head is all pointy─kinda like yours, mister.
dialogue_jp: おじさんみたいに　髪がツンツンしてて

dialogue_en: Oh, Mr. Birdie is a bird friend of ours.
dialogue_jp: ピヨちゃんは　なかよしの小鳥なんだよ

dialogue_en: Uh, y'see, Mr. Birdie ran away and hasn't come back...
dialogue_jp: あのね　ピヨちゃんがどこか行っちゃったの

dialogue_en: Why would he ask you─my own business partner─to take me out? What did I do wrong?
dialogue_jp:
わたしたち　うまくやってきたじゃん
なにが気に入らないの？

dialogue_en: Wait! Hang on a sec! Please!
dialogue_jp: ちょっと　なんで？

dialogue_en:
Hate to break it to you, Kyrie...
but this is no laughing matter.
dialogue_jp: 冗談で済むかどうかは　おまえの返答次第だ

dialogue_en:
He what?
No... This has to be a joke...right?
dialogue_jp: はい？　それ……なんの冗談？

dialogue_en: Said we should "take care" of you.
dialogue_jp: おまえの始末を依頼されている

dialogue_en: Uh...what was it?
dialogue_jp: えっ　なに　どうしたの？

dialogue_en: The mayor had another request.
dialogue_jp: 市長の依頼は　まだ終わってない

dialogue_en: Hold it.
dialogue_jp: 待て

dialogue_en: In that case, I'm gonna go tell the mayor so I can claim my reward!
dialogue_jp: それじゃあ　市長から成功報酬をもらわなくちゃ

dialogue_en: Oh, perfect!
dialogue_jp: スッテキ～！

dialogue_en: Yep.
dialogue_jp: ああ

dialogue_en:
Welcome back, fellow merc!
So, did you take care of those baddies?
dialogue_jp:
おかえりなさ～い
どうだった　ちゃんと退治できた？

dialogue_en: I asked Grandpa to help us look, but he said his back hurt.
dialogue_jp: じぃじは腰が痛いから　手伝えないって

dialogue_en: If he's out here, he must be pretty thirsty. I hope he finds some water.
dialogue_jp:
砂漠か～　クラピヨ
カラカラになってないよな

dialogue_en: Make sure Cloud Jr.'s safe, okay?
dialogue_jp: クラピヨのこと　頼んだよ

dialogue_en: Oh, cool! Then all you gotta do is go into the desert and find him!
dialogue_jp:
ホント？
じゃあ　あとは砂漠に仕掛けるだけだね

dialogue_en: Hey guys! They said they got the bird traps!
dialogue_jp: みんな　鳥のワナが完成したって！

dialogue_en:
Wow, that's great!
Now he's just gotta make some!
dialogue_jp: さすが　あとは作るだけだね！

dialogue_en: Old dude said he got sha-matics for a trap!
dialogue_jp: おじさんが　ワナの設計図を手に入れたって！

dialogue_en: So we just gotta make new ones instead!
dialogue_jp: じゃあ　いちから作るしかないか

dialogue_en: They didn't hunt 'em─just caught 'em for fun and stuff. But Grandpa said you can't find traps like that anywhere anymore.
dialogue_jp:
傷つけないワナを使ってたんだって　でも
いまはもう売ってないって　じぃじが言ってた

dialogue_en: What? But why would they hunt their friends?
dialogue_jp: なんか　ちょっとかわいそう

dialogue_en: Grandpa said in the old days, they used to trap birds all the time.
dialogue_jp: 共和国時代は　よく鳥をとってたんだって

dialogue_en: Oh, cool! Then all you gotta do is go into the desert and find him!
dialogue_jp:
ホント？
じゃあ　あとは砂漠に仕掛けるだけだね

dialogue_en: One step ahead of ya. Already got the tools we need to bag that bird.
dialogue_jp:
安心しろ
鳥のワナならもう持ってるからよ

dialogue_en: Don't you worry. We'll get those bird traps ready in no time, won't we?
dialogue_jp:
安心しろ
鳥のワナなら作れるからよ　なあ？

dialogue_en: Huh... In that case, we'd better figure out how to transmute us some traps.
dialogue_jp:
なるほど　じゃあ
まずはワナを作らねえとな

dialogue_en: Hey. That oughta work for our Cloud Jr.-catchin' purposes, right?
dialogue_jp:
おっ　これでクラピヨを
捕まえられるんじゃねえか？

dialogue_en: I won't pretend it's all for the kids. End of the day, I'm doin' this for me.
dialogue_jp:
子供たちのためじゃねえ
結局　オレのためだ

dialogue_en: Yeah, well, it's stronger than you think.
dialogue_jp: クラピヨ探しも罪滅ぼし

dialogue_en: Just don't go breakin' your back.
dialogue_jp: ほどほどにしてくれ

dialogue_en: Eventually, I realized the excuses I was clingin' to weren't makin' me feel any better. What happened in Corel, that's my burden to bear.
dialogue_jp:
でもな　それじゃあオレの気が済まねえんだ
コレルに関しちゃあ　とことん背負う気でいる

dialogue_en: Took a while to accept that, though. Hell, I did everything in my power to avoid thinkin' about it at all.
dialogue_jp:
ってな　責任逃れの口実ばかり
考えた時期があった

dialogue_en: Right.
dialogue_jp: そうだな

dialogue_en: No, I ain't the one who proposed building the damn thing─that was Shinra. Just hitched my wagon to it.
dialogue_jp:
そもそも　魔晄炉の建設だって
言い出したのは神羅　オレは乗っかっただけだ

dialogue_en: I coulda told ya that.
dialogue_jp: んなことは　わかってる

dialogue_en: What happened with the reactor wasn't your fault, you know.
dialogue_jp: 魔晄炉の爆発は　あんたのせいじゃない

dialogue_en: I understand there's no makin' amends for how I did these people wrong, but...I wanna help. I need to help.
dialogue_jp:
オレは　村にでっけえ借りがあるからよ
すこしでも返してえんだ

dialogue_en: At least somebody will be.
dialogue_jp: まあ　それもあるが

dialogue_en: He'll definitely be happy to see you.
dialogue_jp: あんたに懐いていたからな

dialogue_en: Alright then. Let's go find our bird buddy.
dialogue_jp: よっしゃ　クラピヨ探しといくか

dialogue_en: I hope Cloud Jr.'s okay out there.
dialogue_jp: クラピヨ　無事だといいけど

dialogue_en: Cloud Jr. must be starving! Poor thing...
dialogue_jp: クラピヨ　おなか空かせてないかな

dialogue_en: I expect you'll find this hard to believe, but I've actually changed quite a bit since my younger days.
dialogue_jp:
おまえにゃどう見えてるか知らねえが
こう見えて　オレも変わったんだ

dialogue_en: Dyne and the others helped give me that clarity... Just wish I coulda got it sooner.
dialogue_jp:
村の連中や　ダインと会って
それがわかったぜ

dialogue_en: Savin' the planet's important, but I put a lot of personal stuff on the back burner─and I shouldn't've.
dialogue_jp:
星を救うっていう　でっけえ目的のほかに
オレには向き合わねえといけねえことがある

dialogue_en: But comin' back here, I see how I got tunnel vision. And not 'cause Shinra was all I had to think about. It's 'cause I didn't want to think about anything else.
dialogue_jp:
ただよ　やつら相手にがむしゃらになってたのも
いま思うと　目を逸らしていただけなのかもなって

dialogue_en: Not a damn thing. Shinra's still goin' down.
dialogue_jp: 神羅をぶっつぶすのは　もちろん変わんねえ

dialogue_en: So, what's changed?
dialogue_jp: いまは違うのか

dialogue_en: We were good, Shinra was bad, and if we took 'em out, world would be alright.
dialogue_jp:
神羅っていう大悪党をぶっつぶせれば
それでよかったからな

dialogue_en: Life was a hell of a lot simpler back in ol' Midgar.
dialogue_jp: ミッドガルにいた時は　もっとシンプルだった

dialogue_en: Might as well rig the other traps, then.
dialogue_jp: 残りのふたつも仕掛けちまおうぜ

dialogue_en: And now, we wait.
dialogue_jp: しばらく様子見だな

dialogue_en: Kid's gotta eat.
dialogue_jp: トラップを仕掛けよう

dialogue_en: Think we oughta do somethin' for Cloud Jr. Don't you?
dialogue_jp: クラピヨ探し　忘れてねえだろうな

dialogue_en: Just gotta place 'em in the wastelands now. Hang tight, Cloud Jr.! We'll have you back home in no time.
dialogue_jp:
あとは　これを砂漠に仕掛けるだけだな
待ってろよ～　クラピヨ

dialogue_en: Well, that's the last of the traps.
dialogue_jp: これでワナは　ぜんぶ仕掛けたな

dialogue_en: I know it in my heart.
dialogue_jp: 大事にしようぜ

dialogue_en: They came into my life for a reason─like you did, Cloud. Junior too.
dialogue_jp:
オレたちの出会い
クラピヨとの出会いも　きっと意味がある

dialogue_en: I couldn'ta done it without 'em.
dialogue_jp: 縁がオレを変えた

dialogue_en: Well, I'd say you managed to get yourself back on track.
dialogue_jp: ああ　いまはそこまでじゃない

dialogue_en: Had my fair share of crashes and went off the rails a few times... Caused a lotta trouble for those guys.
dialogue_jp:
衝突や脱線が多くてよお
いらねえトラブル抱え込んで

dialogue_en: Never thought about hittin' the brakes─or anything else.
dialogue_jp: 結局　走るだけで考えてなかった

dialogue_en: I used to be a runaway train, chargin' full speed ahead and draggin' folks along for the ride.
dialogue_jp:
暴走機関車スタイルで
走りながら考えて　仲間を引っ張ってきたが

dialogue_en: Sure was. And not just her: the whole team helped me get my act together.
dialogue_jp:
猛省したぜ
で　次はアバランチだな

dialogue_en: She was right.
dialogue_jp: どうかしてる

dialogue_en: Said sleepin' outside was risky.
dialogue_jp: それまでは　野宿だったんだ

dialogue_en: Started yellin' about how a kid like Marlene needed a proper roof over her head─somewhere safe and clean.
dialogue_jp:
マリンには　安心して眠れる場所と
清潔な環境が必要だって怒ってよ

dialogue_en: Oh, got fed up with my bullshit and tore me a new one.
dialogue_jp: な　よっぽどのことだったんだよな

dialogue_en: That so? What'd she do?
dialogue_jp: ティファが？　意外だ

dialogue_en: Thanks to Tifa, mostly. She really set me straight─'specially as a parent. Wouldn't be half the father I am today without her.
dialogue_jp:
まず　ティファの説教が効いたな
スラムで出会った頃の話だ　マリンのことでな

dialogue_en: Oh?
dialogue_jp: クラウド

dialogue_en: You had us scared, Junior! Thought you were gonna wind up monster chow.
dialogue_jp: ったく　心配かけやがって

dialogue_en: Cheep cheep!
dialogue_jp: ピヨピヨ！

dialogue_en: Let's move!
dialogue_jp: させるか！

dialogue_en: Cheep!
dialogue_jp: ピーーーッ！

dialogue_en: Look!
dialogue_jp: 見ろ！

dialogue_en: Hey, I think we finally found our boy.
dialogue_jp: あれ　クラピヨじゃねえか

dialogue_en: Then let's go and check another.
dialogue_jp: ほかのトラップを確認してみよう

dialogue_en: Looks the same as when we left it.
dialogue_jp: まだ　なんにも掛かってねえな

dialogue_en: Let's check the other.
dialogue_jp: まだトラップはある

dialogue_en: Didn't even leave a crumb.
dialogue_jp: やってくれるぜ

dialogue_en: Not again. Quit stealin' Junior's food!
dialogue_jp: おいおい　クラピヨのエサを食うんじゃねえ！

dialogue_en: We've got more.
dialogue_jp: 次がある

dialogue_en: Went through the trouble of makin' that trap, and look how they treat it! What a waste.
dialogue_jp: チッ！　せっかく作ったワナを壊しやがって

dialogue_en: Hey, take a hike! That food ain't for you!
dialogue_jp: なっ　この野郎～！

dialogue_en: Only one way to find out.
dialogue_jp: よし　戻るか

dialogue_en: Our bird might've already been caught in one of the others.
dialogue_jp:
そろそろ　ほかのトラップに
掛かってるかもしれない

dialogue_en: Don't know, man...
dialogue_jp: 俺にはわからない

dialogue_en:
You'll feel better, maybe, but...
how do you think she'll feel?
dialogue_jp:
あんたは良くても
マリンにとって　いいことなのか？

dialogue_en: I owe it to her father.
dialogue_jp: 贖罪だからな

dialogue_en: Uh...you sure that's a good idea?
dialogue_jp: それは　いいことなのか

dialogue_en:
Hope I can bring Marlene back here one day.
Tell her about her home and everything else.
dialogue_jp:
いつか　マリンといっしょにここに来てよ
ぜんぶ話してやりてえんだ

dialogue_en: Hey, just doin' our job!
dialogue_jp: どういたしまして

dialogue_en: No wonder! Thank you so much!
dialogue_jp: そうだったんだ　ありがとう！

dialogue_en: 'Course he did. When we found him, we said, "Your friends're lookin' for ya. You head straight home."
dialogue_jp:
だろ？　ちゃんと帰るように
しっかり言い聞かせといたからな

dialogue_en: Oh! Hey, mister, he's back! Cloud Jr. came back!
dialogue_jp:
あっ　おじさん
クラピヨが帰ってきたよ！

dialogue_en: Cheep cheep!
dialogue_jp: ピピ！

dialogue_en: But go straight home, y'hear me?
dialogue_jp: もう迷子になるんじゃねえぞ

dialogue_en: Cheep!
dialogue_jp: ピヨ！

dialogue_en: Is that your way of sayin' you're good on your own?
dialogue_jp:
おっ　なんだ
ひとりで帰れんのか？

dialogue_en: Cheep!
dialogue_jp: ピヨ！

dialogue_en: Well, if it isn't the talk of the resort! I can't thank you enough for handling that mess.
dialogue_jp:
これはこれは　みなさま
いつぞやは　お世話になりました

dialogue_en: Grandpa said he used to be the best hunter in the world. Musta been before he hurt his back.
dialogue_jp:
じぃじは昔　凄腕のハンターだったって
ホントかな？

dialogue_en: I thought feathers are supposed to be soft. How come yours are all pointy?
dialogue_jp:
クラピヨの毛って
なんでこんなにツンツンしてんだろ

dialogue_en: Someday, you're gonna be big and strong and scare away all the monsters!
dialogue_jp:
はやくでかくなって
モンスターを倒せるようになれよ

dialogue_en: I wonder if Mommy would let Cloud Jr. stay with us.
dialogue_jp: クラピヨ　ウチに連れて帰りた～い

dialogue_en: No more running away, Cloud Jr. You hear me?
dialogue_jp: クラピヨ　もう遠くへいっちゃダメですよ

dialogue_en: Grandpa said he'll prob'ly grow real big─bigger than me!
dialogue_jp: じぃじが言うには　そこそこ大きくなるって

dialogue_en: He's still growin' right? How big's he gonna get?
dialogue_jp: こいつ　どれぐらい大きくなるのかな？

dialogue_en: Go on, eat up!
dialogue_jp: たーんとおたべ

dialogue_en: Don't mention it!
dialogue_jp: ありがとうな

dialogue_en: Thanks again for all your help, mister!
dialogue_jp: ぼく　おじさん好きだよ！

dialogue_en: Us old fellas gotta go. Take care of Cloud Jr.
dialogue_jp: オレたちは行くから　クラピヨと遊んでやれ

dialogue_en: That so...? Well, don't wanna get you in trouble.
dialogue_jp: そうか　そりゃ仕方ねえな

dialogue_en: My dad says we're supposed to stay away from you... Sorry.
dialogue_jp: おじさんから離れろって　父さんが言ってるって

dialogue_en: ...What's up?
dialogue_jp: どうした？

dialogue_en: It won't last─and neither will his hilltop roachtrap. Just give it time...
dialogue_jp:
あんな立地の悪いホテルが繁盛するはずありません
そのうち潰れますよ

dialogue_en: I hope the "hero" is enjoying his fifteen minutes of fame.
dialogue_jp:
いまは　街を救ったヒーローなどと
チヤホヤされているようですが

dialogue_en:
Who?
Oh, that ungrateful schlub.
dialogue_jp:
ジョニー？
ああ　あの恩知らずですか

dialogue_en: Shinra also did us a service by providing us with a generous do─ oh, uh...forget I said anything.
dialogue_jp:
それにあのあと　神羅から多額の献金……
おっと　口がすべりました

dialogue_en: In all honesty, the professor did us a service by ridding us of those robes. The freaks were ruining our ambiance.
dialogue_jp:
むしろ　忌々しい黒マントどもを掃除できて
博士に感謝したいぐらいですよ

dialogue_en: There were a few injuries, yes, but no guests were killed.
dialogue_jp:
多少のケガ人は出ましたが
まあ　その程度です

dialogue_en: it fills me with pride to be the mayor who holds a special footnote in Shinra's illustrious history.
dialogue_jp:
神羅の発展のためにご協力できたことを
市長として誇りに思ってますよ

dialogue_en: So while I could have done without the collateral damage...
dialogue_jp: だから　すこしばかり被害は出ましたが

dialogue_en: Still, I'm a simple man, and from what I gather, his experiment was of great scientific import.
dialogue_jp:
ただ　よくよく話を聞けば　あれは
非常に高尚な実験だったというじゃないですか

dialogue_en: I certainly wasn't expecting the professor to do something like...that.
dialogue_jp:
まさか　宝条博士が
あんなことをするとは　ねえ？

dialogue_en: Is there anything I can do for you?
dialogue_jp: 本日は　どういったご用件でしょう？

dialogue_en: Not yet, at least.
dialogue_jp: あいつ次第だ

dialogue_en: I mean, lying isn't the greatest, but...she doesn't deserve that.
dialogue_jp:
キリエ　ちょ～っと
調子に乗っちゃっただけだと思うな

dialogue_en: So, uh... What about the mayor's other request? Y'know─the whole "take care of her" thing?
dialogue_jp:
ねえ　もうひとつの依頼はどうする？
『なんでも屋を始末しろ』ってヤツ

dialogue_en: Right.
dialogue_jp: だね

dialogue_en: Better go tell Kyrie.
dialogue_jp: キリエのところへ戻ろう

dialogue_en: Spoke too soon.
dialogue_jp: 成功だな

dialogue_en: Some "legend." This bait's a bust!
dialogue_jp: もっといいエサがいるんじゃない？

dialogue_en: Let's see if those baddies take the bait!
dialogue_jp: エサ　投げてみる？

dialogue_en: No sign of trouble... Maybe we've gotta lure 'em out.
dialogue_jp: モンスターが出るのって　このあたりだよね

dialogue_en: It's time she learned there are some folks you don't cross.
dialogue_jp: お嬢さんに　大人の怖さを教えておかないと

dialogue_en: She's been spending the money I paid her to do nothing but party.
dialogue_jp:
金を受け取ったのに
仕事もせずに　パーティーざんまい

dialogue_en: Uh...
dialogue_jp: えっ？

dialogue_en: I want you to take care of that merc.
dialogue_jp: なんでも屋さんも始末してください

dialogue_en: Oh, and after you've gotten rid of those monsters, as a personal favor...
dialogue_jp:
ああそれと　これは別件ですが
モンスター退治が終わったら

dialogue_en:
I paid her a handsome sum up front too...
so I intend to get my money's worth.
dialogue_jp:
安くはない前金を払っていますのでね
ちゃんと働いてもらわないと

dialogue_en: only to go on a bender at a bar on the beach.
dialogue_jp:
遊びほうけて
いっこうに仕事をしてくれません

dialogue_en: The young lady agreed to exterminate those pests...
dialogue_jp: なんでも屋のお嬢さんに　討伐を依頼したのですが

dialogue_en: You see, some fiends popped out of the water and assaulted a group of innocent beachgoers the other day.
dialogue_jp:
実は　海から現れたモンスターに
観光客が襲われるという事件がありまして

dialogue_en:
Oh, perhaps you're associates!
That makes things easier.
dialogue_jp:
おお　お知り合いですか
それは好都合

dialogue_en: Kyrie...
dialogue_jp: キリエか……

dialogue_en: What's this about a merc?
dialogue_jp: なんでも屋が来てるのか？

dialogue_en: Oh, surely I can sell you on the idea of lending the merc I've hired a hand?
dialogue_jp:
どうでしょう　みなさんで
なんでも屋さんを手伝ってもらえませんか？

dialogue_en: I'm not buyin' it.
dialogue_jp: うさんくさ……

dialogue_en: Well, all that ugliness is in the past. Let's look to our future─one that's bright and mutually beneficial.
dialogue_jp:
まあ　過去のいざこざは波に流して
我々も新しい関係を築こうではありませんか

dialogue_en: Figured I'd set up shop here─in case there's trouble in paradise.
dialogue_jp:
えへへ　リゾートにも出店してみたんだけど
どうかな？

dialogue_en: Oh! Hey there, Cloud! Welcome to my Costa del Sol headquarters.
dialogue_jp:
あっ　クラウド
なんでも屋コスタ支店へ　ようこそ～！

dialogue_en: You gotta live it up, Cloud!
dialogue_jp: クラウドも　踊ってく？

dialogue_en: All work and no play is a waste of a good vacay. And "When in Costa del Sol..."
dialogue_jp:
せっかくのリゾートなんだから
仕事だけじゃなくて　遊びもね！

dialogue_en: So don't you worry about me, my fellow merc.
dialogue_jp: 社員くん　安心したまえ～

dialogue_en: I know Junon was kind of a bust, but I'm back and better than ever. Same goes for my advertising!
dialogue_jp:
ジュノンでの失敗をふまえて
今回はほら　宣伝もカンペキ！

dialogue_en: Figured I'd set up shop here─in case there's trouble in paradise.
dialogue_jp:
えへへ　リゾートにも出店してみたんだけど
どうかな？

dialogue_en: Oh! Hey there, Cloud! Welcome to my Costa del Sol headquarters.
dialogue_jp:
あっ　クラウド
なんでも屋コスタ支店へ　ようこそ～！

dialogue_en: Hm-hm-hm hmmm, hm-hm-hm hmmm...♪
dialogue_jp: フンフンフンフ～ン

dialogue_en: Hm-hm-hm-hm-hm-hm, hm-hm-hm-hm-hm-hm-hm-hmmm...♪
dialogue_jp: フフンフンフ～ン♪

dialogue_en: Hm hm-hm, duhn duh-duh...♪
dialogue_jp: フンフンフフ～ンフ～ンフフ～ン♪

dialogue_en: Dealing with those monsters should bring my approval rating back up just in time for the next election.
dialogue_jp:
次の市長選のためにも　モンスターを掃除して
支持率を回復しておきたいんですよ

dialogue_en: See that those fiends─and that brat─get what's coming to them.
dialogue_jp:
モンスターと　なんでも屋の処遇
おまかせしましたよ

dialogue_en: I've no doubt you'll find her at that damned bar. Do give her my regards.
dialogue_jp:
なんでも屋さんは　ビーチのバーにいます
よろしくお願いしますよ

dialogue_en: Agreed.
dialogue_jp: たしかに

dialogue_en: She's got a point.
dialogue_jp: でしょ～？

dialogue_en: But if we don't do something, it's your good name that's gonna end up taking the hit.
dialogue_jp:
でも　このままじゃ
クラウドの名前にも傷がつくよね

dialogue_en: Man, this girl's got some nerve. And comin' from me, that's sayin' a lot.
dialogue_jp:
あんまり厚かましくて
さすがのアタシもびっくり

dialogue_en: Nobody likes a slacker.
dialogue_jp: 責任とってよね

dialogue_en: Exactly! So don't try to pin it on this merc. The whole situation would be resolved if you did your job.
dialogue_jp:
そっ！　仕事が進んでいないのは
クラウドが出勤しなかったからだよ？

dialogue_en: Lemme guess: me?
dialogue_jp: つまり　俺か

dialogue_en: All that's left is to have someone else do the cleanup.
dialogue_jp: あとは　現場監督が倒すだけ

dialogue_en: And for the record, I have been working, thank you very much! I figured out where the fiends are prob'ly gonna show.
dialogue_jp:
わたしだって　ちゃんと働いてました～
モンスターが出現する場所は特定済み！

dialogue_en: Ugh, really? Another lecture? For a twenty-something, you sound like my grandma.
dialogue_jp:
なに　小言いいにきたの？
おばあちゃんみたいなことしないでよね

dialogue_en: Aren't you s'posed to be working?
dialogue_jp: モンスター討伐はどうした？

dialogue_en: Hello again, my fellow merc! Come to crash this killer party?
dialogue_jp:
おお　社員くん
やっぱりパーティーが気になる？

dialogue_en: So don't you worry about me, my fellow merc.
dialogue_jp: 社員くん　安心したまえ～

dialogue_en: I know Junon was kind of a bust, but I'm back and better than ever. Same goes for my advertising!
dialogue_jp:
ジュノンでの失敗をふまえて
今回はほら　宣伝もカンペキ！

dialogue_en: You're clearly not the party type, so I'll handle this client-facing crap and leave you the fun stuff!
dialogue_jp:
現場監督のクラウドが退屈しないように
しっかり宣伝しとくね～

dialogue_en: What better way to drum up new business than by throwing a fabulous party? I shoulda thought of this ages ago!
dialogue_jp:
このパーティーも立派な仕事だからね～
最高の宣伝になるんだから

dialogue_en: Which is why it's off-limits now─except to you.
dialogue_jp: 遊泳禁止になってる海岸に行ってみて

dialogue_en: Can't believe fiends just leapt outta the water and attacked people on the beach.
dialogue_jp: モンスターは海から来て　観光客を襲ったの

dialogue_en: Head to the off-limits beach and sprinkle that nasty stuff around!
dialogue_jp: 遊泳禁止になってる海岸があるから　行ってみて

dialogue_en: Now all you gotta do is lure those fiends out and bash their brains in.
dialogue_jp:
じゃあ　あとはモンスターを呼び寄せて
倒すだけ！

dialogue_en: Oho! Looks like you managed to whip up some bait!
dialogue_jp: おっ　エサができたみたいだね

dialogue_en: And I do mean rare. Probably can't find 'em around here... Oh, did I say "probably"? I meant "definitely."
dialogue_jp:
コスタでは　エサの材料が手に入らなかったの
ほかの地域で探したほうがいいかもね

dialogue_en: According to the recipe, it looks like you're gonna need to get some rare-ass monster parts.
dialogue_jp:
エサを作るには
珍しいモンスターの素材が必要みたい

dialogue_en: You're comin' with. Can't do this alone.
dialogue_jp: 仕方がない　つきあってくれ

dialogue_en: When you're done, head to the off-limits beach across town for some monster-baiting!
dialogue_jp:
エサができたら
遊泳禁止になってる海岸に行ってみて

dialogue_en: Here.
dialogue_jp: キリエ

dialogue_en: All you need to do is gather the materials and make some for yourself!
dialogue_jp: クラウドは材料を集めて　クラフトをお願い

dialogue_en: Your thoughtful boss has dug up a recipe for bait that oughta lure those monsters out of hiding.
dialogue_jp:
モンスターを呼び寄せる　エサのレシピは
社長のわたしが用意したから

dialogue_en: So! Here's the deal:
dialogue_jp: と　いうわけで！

dialogue_en: It seems your performance didn't just save the hotel's reputation; it also saved a relationship.
dialogue_jp:
キミの演奏は　このホテルだけではなく
恋人たちも救ったようだな

dialogue_en: He and his partner left for a place where nothing can come between the two of them ever again.
dialogue_jp:
愛するパートナーとともに
誰にも邪魔されぬ街へと旅立ったそうだ

dialogue_en: I received word from the pianist who eloped.
dialogue_jp: 例の駆け落ちしたピアニストだが

dialogue_en: Allow me to speak for the lady. First there's the on-call rate, then there's my finder's fee, and on top of that...
dialogue_jp:
その話ならあたしがするよ
呼び出し料に紹介料　そうだね　あとは――

dialogue_en: Now, as for what we owe you for your performance...
dialogue_jp: それから　演奏の報酬についてですが

dialogue_en: Here you are. A companion card and a memento─what we give all our concertgoers.
dialogue_jp:
こちら　コンサートの参加者にお渡ししている
アモールカードと記念品です

dialogue_en: Thank you so much for performing!
dialogue_jp: あなたのおかげで　助かりました！

dialogue_en: Now then, let's give our pianist a warm round of applause!
dialogue_jp:
皆様　ピアニストに
いまいちど盛大な拍手を！

dialogue_en: A consummate performance─true perfection!
dialogue_jp: 非の打ち所がない　完璧な演奏でした！

dialogue_en: Oh, how her fingers danced upon the keys─so playful, yet earnest!
dialogue_jp:
鍵盤のうえで踊る指先
軽やかながらも　情感たっぷりなリズム

dialogue_en:
I mean, c'mon, we're in Costa del Sol, people!
Costa. Del. Sol!
dialogue_jp:
だって　コスタ・デル・ソルだよ？
コスタ・デル・ソル！

dialogue_en: So a little sightseeing couldn't hurt, could it?
dialogue_jp: ちょっとだけ　観光してこ？

dialogue_en: Right!
dialogue_jp: エアリス

dialogue_en: Should prob'ly wait for them.
dialogue_jp: あいつらが　動き出したらな

dialogue_en:
We just arrived and I already hate it.
C'mon, let's get outta here.
dialogue_jp:
こんな　チャラチャラしたところに用はねえ！
さっさと通り過ぎるぞ

dialogue_en: Catch ya later!
dialogue_jp: おっさき～！

dialogue_en: Posed as a merc.
dialogue_jp: なんでも屋を名乗ったこと

dialogue_en: What did she do wrong?
dialogue_jp: なにが気に入らないの？

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: Set the bait for Cloud Jr.?
dialogue_jp: バードトラップを仕掛けますか？

dialogue_en: Nothing.
dialogue_jp: 用はない

dialogue_en: Johnny.
dialogue_jp: ジョニーについて

dialogue_en: The damages.
dialogue_jp: コスタの被害について

dialogue_en: Think long and hard.
dialogue_jp: 自分の胸に手を当てて考えろ

dialogue_en: Passed off my work as yours.
dialogue_jp: 依頼を投げだすところ

dialogue_en: Mr. Birdieee, where aaare you?
dialogue_jp: ピヨちゃーん　どこいったの～？

dialogue_en: Here, birdy bird!
dialogue_jp: ピヨピヨー！

dialogue_en: For the right price.
dialogue_jp: 安くないぞ

dialogue_en: Someone's a softie.
dialogue_jp: 子供には甘いな

dialogue_en: "Old fella"?
dialogue_jp: おじさんじゃない

dialogue_en: "Why don't you talk to this old fella instead?"
dialogue_jp: このおじさんが　なんでも解決してくれるぜ

dialogue_en: Mention that something seems off.
dialogue_jp: 疑う

dialogue_en: Question them about the kidnapper.
dialogue_jp: 犯人について尋ねる

dialogue_en: Help them.
dialogue_jp: 助ける

dialogue_en: What will you do?
dialogue_jp: 彼女たちをどうしますか？

dialogue_en: The victim.
dialogue_jp: 黒マント

dialogue_en: The letter.
dialogue_jp: 手紙

dialogue_en: Eyewitnesses.
dialogue_jp: 目撃者

dialogue_en: What will you ask about?
dialogue_jp: なにから調べますか？

dialogue_en: Challenge Amina?
dialogue_jp: アミナと腹筋勝負しますか？

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: An unwavering resolve for gains.
dialogue_jp: 気持ち

dialogue_en: A post-workout meal.
dialogue_jp: 食事

dialogue_en: Training equipment.
dialogue_jp: トレーニング器具

dialogue_en:
"What would you say is
the key to a good workout?"
dialogue_jp: 筋トレに大事なものがなにか　わかるかい？

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: Try again?
dialogue_jp: もういちど　挑戦しますか？

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: Enter Run Wild's <color=yellow>Time Trial</color> challenge?
dialogue_jp:
【ラン・ワイルド　タイムアタック】
挑戦しますか？

dialogue_en: None.
dialogue_jp: 渡さない

dialogue_en: The gigantopod shell.
dialogue_jp: 巨大な貝殻を渡す

dialogue_en: The conch.
dialogue_jp: 巻貝を渡す

dialogue_en: The scallop shell.
dialogue_jp: 二枚貝を渡す

dialogue_en: Which of the shells will you hand over?
dialogue_jp: どの貝殻を渡しますか？

dialogue_en: What will you do?
dialogue_jp: 依頼を引き受けますか？

dialogue_en: Try again?
dialogue_jp: もういちど　挑戦しますか？

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: Try the <color=yellow>Ghost Ship</color> stage of Pirate's Rampage?
dialogue_jp:
【パイレーツ・ランページ　幽霊船ステージ】
挑戦しますか？

dialogue_en: I do you one better─dump him in the reactor.
dialogue_jp: いや　魔晄炉のほうがいいだろ

dialogue_en: Now's our chance to dump his ass down a mine shaft!
dialogue_jp: 炭坑の穴に突き落としてやろうか

dialogue_en: I heard tell Barret came waltzin' back into town after all this time.
dialogue_jp:
バレットのやつ　いまさらよく
のこのこ戻ってきたな

dialogue_en: Welcome to nowheresville, North Corel.
dialogue_jp:
どん詰まりの北コレルへ
ようこそ

dialogue_en: One day at a time, am I right?
dialogue_jp: おまえも人生詰んでるのか

dialogue_en: So much for the glory days... Coal ain't worth squat.
dialogue_jp: 石炭の時代は　もう来ねえよなあ

dialogue_en: Ain't had no honest work since that damn reactor blew.
dialogue_jp:
魔晄炉建設の事故以来
行き場がねえんだ

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: Shinra 'spects us to live off the scraps they toss our way? May as well tell us to go die in a ditch.
dialogue_jp:
神羅の生活保護じゃ　ぜんぜん足りねえ
野垂れ死ねってことかね

dialogue_en: Gotta wonder what the youngins think of us. Sittin' around, drinkin' the day away...
dialogue_jp:
いまのガキどもは
昼間から飲んでる俺たちを
どう思ってんだろうな

dialogue_en: I looked up to the adults comin' home caked in soot and sweat after a hard day's work. Don't see that no more, though.
dialogue_jp:
ガキの頃
大人は汗と炭まみれで真っ黒で
かっこよかったよな

dialogue_en: Look at 'em. Not a care in the world. I envy that.
dialogue_jp:
ガキは気楽でいいな
俺も戻りてえよ

dialogue_en: Hear, hear. Better than that bastard deserved.
dialogue_jp:
ああ　あいつには
もったいねえくらいのな

dialogue_en: And a mighty fine woman too.
dialogue_jp: ありゃ　いい女だった

dialogue_en: Barret's wife, right?
dialogue_jp: バレットの嫁さんだろ

dialogue_en: Hey. You remember Myrna?
dialogue_jp: おう　ミーナって覚えてるか？

dialogue_en: Mako is the future, my ass. More like the death of everything good in our lives.
dialogue_jp:
あいつが　魔晄炉を作ろうだなんて
言わなきゃ　オレたちの村は
静かなまま暮らせたんだ

dialogue_en: Damn straight. He's the one who pushed for it in the first place. It's the least the sumbitch can do to make amends.
dialogue_jp:
おう　魔晄炉建設推進派のリーダー
バレット様に塞いでもらうのが筋だな

dialogue_en: That's what they call "poetic justice"!
dialogue_jp: 自業自得ってヤツよ

dialogue_en: Use him as a plug to stop the monsters from pourin' out.
dialogue_jp:
あそこから出てくるモンスターに
フタしねえと

dialogue_en: Take the job.
dialogue_jp: 引き受けよう

dialogue_en: Ask about Hojo.
dialogue_jp: 宝条博士について

dialogue_en: Ask why they picked you two.
dialogue_jp: どうして俺たちが？

dialogue_en: People round here don't take kindly to outsiders.
dialogue_jp: ここじゃ　よそ者は歓迎されないよ

dialogue_en: We ain't gonna put up with any mischief.
dialogue_jp: 騒ぎを起こさないでほしいわ

dialogue_en: Ain't nothin' here for you.
dialogue_jp: ふん　遊べる場所はないわよ

dialogue_en: How do ya like that?
dialogue_jp: らっくしょ～！

dialogue_en: Did you see that!?
dialogue_jp: やった～！

dialogue_en: I wouldn't recommend stickin' around for long.
dialogue_jp:
お兄さん
はやく出ていくほうがいいよ

dialogue_en: This is nothin'!
dialogue_jp: 楽勝だぜ

dialogue_en: Gonna leave you in the dust!
dialogue_jp: いっくぞ～！

dialogue_en: I'm the one who paid for it in the first place!
dialogue_jp: どうせ　俺が恵んでやった酒だろうが！

dialogue_en: Aw, shut up. I can drink whatever the hell I want!
dialogue_jp:
うっせえ！
細かいことでガタガタぬかすな

dialogue_en: Where do you get off, drinkin' all my booze!?
dialogue_jp:
てめえ　オレの酒
飲みやがったな！

dialogue_en: It's your own damn fault for pissin' away the day bitchin' and moanin'.
dialogue_jp:
へたに働けば
なんももらえなくなるからな

dialogue_en: Exactly. You don't do your bit, you ain't owed shit.
dialogue_jp:
だからみんな昼間から
道端でゴロゴロしてんだ

dialogue_en: Buckle down and your day will come.
dialogue_jp: 無茶しなきゃ　なんとかなるし

dialogue_en: Shinra'll take care of you if you pull your weight.
dialogue_jp: 神羅はよくやってくれてるほうだよ

dialogue_en: That's 'cause you spend your time drinkin' 'stead of lookin' for honest work.
dialogue_jp:
あんたが　働きもせず
酒ばっか飲むからだ

dialogue_en: In Corel, it's every man, woman, and child for themselves.
dialogue_jp:
北コレルじゃ　自分の身は
自分で守るのがルールだ

dialogue_en: Don't expect us to come runnin' if a monster jumps ya.
dialogue_jp:
モンスターに襲われたって
助けねえぞ

dialogue_en: Well I'll be. Not often we get visitors.
dialogue_jp: なんだ旅人か　めずらしいな

dialogue_en: Got any candy?
dialogue_jp: おやつ　ちょうだい

dialogue_en: I'll take anything you don't want. Anything!
dialogue_jp: いらないもの　もらってあげる

dialogue_en: Got any gil for me? Huh? Huh?
dialogue_jp: おこづかい　ほしい

dialogue_en: Give us somethin', wouldja?
dialogue_jp: なんか　くれよ～

dialogue_en: One gil─pay up!
dialogue_jp: １ギルくれ～

dialogue_en: You gotta pay the toll!
dialogue_jp: ツウコウリョウよこせ～！

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: 絶対あってる

dialogue_en: Hand over the marred crown?
dialogue_jp: 本当にキズだらけの王冠であってます？

dialogue_en: And all's we gotta do is tighten the screws. Like takin' candy from a baby.
dialogue_jp:
店長おどして奪い取るだけか
楽勝だな

dialogue_en: Bet this one'll fetch a ton of gil.
dialogue_jp: こいつは高くさばけそうだぜ

dialogue_en: Gotta say, not a bad selection.
dialogue_jp: ひひひ　悪くねえマテリアだ

dialogue_en: And a short one too. If I'm lucky.
dialogue_jp:
あいつのところに
はやく行ってやるのさ

dialogue_en: Maybe that's why I joined the watch. No more pretendin'─an honest life.
dialogue_jp:
あたしが自警団なんてやってるのも
罪滅ぼしなのかもしれないね

dialogue_en: Not a day goes by I don't wonder, "Would my husband still be here if we hadn't let them build that damn reactor?"
dialogue_jp:
魔晄炉なんて作らなきゃ
あたしの旦那はまだ生きてたのかもって
いまだに　ふと思っちまうんだ

dialogue_en: Almost wish they'd get on with it already─put us outta our misery. This kind of livin' takes its toll on you...
dialogue_jp:
モンスターが襲ってきたら
真っ先に食われて
真っ先に楽になれるな

dialogue_en: Now they eye us like we're their next meal...
dialogue_jp:
ここも　いつ襲われるか
わかったもんじゃない

dialogue_en: Used to be this mountain was quiet as a dormouse─harmless as one, too. Fiends didn't bother us none.
dialogue_jp:
コレル山は　昔は静かな山だったが
いまじゃモンスターの巣窟だ

dialogue_en: Hand over the marred one.
dialogue_jp: キズだらけの王冠を渡す

dialogue_en: Give the Tonberry King's crown to Johnny?
dialogue_jp: トンベリキングの王冠を渡しますか？

dialogue_en: Do you have any idea what we've been through!?
dialogue_jp:
どんな思いで
生きてきたと思ってるの！

dialogue_en: You stole everything from us!
dialogue_jp: なにもかも奪われたのよ

dialogue_en: Apologies ain't gonna cut it!
dialogue_jp: 謝罪だけじゃ許されねえぞ

dialogue_en: Get the hell outta here!
dialogue_jp: さっさと出てけ！

dialogue_en: It's your fault we ain't got no work!
dialogue_jp: おまえのせいで仕事がねえんだ

dialogue_en: Ain't givin' you none, if that's why you're starin'. Then again...everything's got its price.
dialogue_jp:
頼まれても　やらねえぞ
買ってくれるなら考えるけどな

dialogue_en: Whatchu lookin' at? It's water, case you're wonderin'. Can't afford to buy the real stuff.
dialogue_jp:
なんだ　これは水だぜ
ホンモノは買えねえからな

dialogue_en: All we gotta do is take what ain't ours.
dialogue_jp: あとはブツさえ手に入りゃあ……

dialogue_en: Yeah, no worries there. I know a guy.
dialogue_jp:
ああ　心配ない
ルートは確保した

dialogue_en: Easy now. Ain't like the shop's gonna up and walk away. This just gives us more time to plan.
dialogue_jp:
あせるなって　店は逃げねえよ
計画立ててる時が楽しいんじゃねえか

dialogue_en: I heard they got their shit took. Damn shame, that.
dialogue_jp:
強盗に入られたんだって
気の毒ね

dialogue_en: Had to close up shop for good, huh?
dialogue_jp: とうとう廃業しちゃったのね

dialogue_en: I hope the owner's doing alright...
dialogue_jp: 店主は　元気にしてっかな

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: やっぱり違う

dialogue_en: Hand over the boiler valve?
dialogue_jp: ボイラーバルブを渡しますか？

dialogue_en: I understand. Believe me, I do. We'll get through it together.
dialogue_jp:
コレルプリズンは生き地獄だったんだ
無理もねえよ

dialogue_en: God, it just...felt so...real.
dialogue_jp:
冷や汗が止まらねえ
頭が真っ白になっちまう

dialogue_en: I was...I was there.
dialogue_jp: 急に昔のことを思い出すんだ

dialogue_en: Hey, deep breaths. The boss ain't here. No one's gonna hurt you, promise.
dialogue_jp:
落ち着け　ボスはもういねえよ
誰もおまえをボコボコにはしねえ

dialogue_en: Sorry! I'm sorry! I promise I'll do it right next time! Just don't hit me!
dialogue_jp:
ひいいっ　すまねえ
次はうまくやるから殴らないでくれ！

dialogue_en: We weren't askin' for much─just a little more...
dialogue_jp:
魔晄炉がある暮らしに
夢を見ていたんだよね……

dialogue_en: I just...miss what we used to have.
dialogue_jp: ここも　昔は良かったのよ

dialogue_en: There's gotta be somethin' we can do to move forward.
dialogue_jp: 俺らにできることって　なんだろうな

dialogue_en: No point pickin' a fight now.
dialogue_jp: バレットに絡んでも仕方ねえ

dialogue_en: Whatever... Whinin' never got nobody nowhere.
dialogue_jp: 文句ばっかじゃ腹が減るだけだ

dialogue_en: Hold on to it for now.
dialogue_jp: 渡さない

dialogue_en: Ask how he thinks you'll get the crown.
dialogue_jp: 王冠の入手方法は？

dialogue_en: Hand over the pristine one.
dialogue_jp: キレイな王冠を渡す

dialogue_en: Wouldn't need 'em if it weren't for the state of the world.
dialogue_jp: 物騒だから欲しいんだけどねえ

dialogue_en: That's some mighty fine stuff. Not that I can afford it...
dialogue_jp: かっこいいねえ　買えないけど

dialogue_en: Spread that wealth around, why don't ya?
dialogue_jp: 金あるなら恵んでくれよ

dialogue_en: Look at moneybags here goin' shoppin'.
dialogue_jp: 買い物なんて　いいご身分で

dialogue_en: Ahaha! They can't take your past from ya! And when you live in the past, you don't need no future!
dialogue_jp:
ハッハッハ　俺はしあわせ！
いまがいちばん自由で豊かだぞ？

dialogue_en: And when you're bored, remember the good ol' days. The coal and the gil and the glory!
dialogue_jp:
退屈したら　炭坑時代を思い出せば
仕事したつもりになれるぞ

dialogue_en: When you're hungry, remember something great you ate. Then you can eat the memory!
dialogue_jp:
腹が減ったら　むかし食った
うまいもんを思い出せば
腹いっぱいになれるぞ

dialogue_en: Wow... What a gorgeous cover.
dialogue_jp: わあ～　きれいな表紙

dialogue_en: It's all gibberish to me.
dialogue_jp: ちんぷんかんぷん……

dialogue_en: Bet the extra thick ones would make for good training weights.
dialogue_jp: 分厚いのなら　腕を鍛えられそうだ

dialogue_en: If we ain't got work, may as well read, I suppose.
dialogue_jp:
こんなの読むより
働いたほうがいいな

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: 渡さない

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: 渡す

dialogue_en: No.
dialogue_jp: 渡さない

dialogue_en: Need to know where they are first.
dialogue_jp: 材料について聞く

dialogue_en: Yes.
dialogue_jp: 持っているだけ渡す

dialogue_en: Give Johnny the materials?
dialogue_jp: 集めた材料を渡しますか？

dialogue_en: Oughta thank whoever found 'em. Kids would've been crushed if those birds were never seen again.
dialogue_jp:
村のガキどものアイドルだからな
探してくれたやつに感謝だ

dialogue_en: That sixth sense of hers prob'ly kept 'em safe.
dialogue_jp:
ビビりで　うまくモンスターから
隠れてたんだろう

dialogue_en: Well, that's a relief.
dialogue_jp: ああ　よかった

dialogue_en: Hope they're alright. Always feel safer when they're around...
dialogue_jp:
あいつは　俺たちの守り神だ
無事だといいがな

dialogue_en: She's prob'ly lookin' all over the desert for him.
dialogue_jp:
ピヨ子も砂漠を
探しまわってるんだろうな

dialogue_en: That she did. And a lotta good folks are better off for it.
dialogue_jp:
おかげで　俺たちはまだ生きてる
ピヨ子さまさまだ

dialogue_en: She was a jumpy little thing, wasn't she? Raised holy hell at the first whiff of gas.
dialogue_jp:
ビビりだから
ちょっと空気が薄くなると
すぐ大騒ぎしてくれるんだよな

dialogue_en: She used to be no bigger 'n' a chunk of coal back when she was in the tunnels with us.
dialogue_jp:
いっしょに炭坑に入ってたときは
ちっこかったのにな

dialogue_en: Ain't little no more. Got a chick of her own now even.
dialogue_jp: 子連れなんて　大きくなったもんだ

dialogue_en: Nah. Way too expensive.
dialogue_jp:
う～ん
高い　高すぎる

dialogue_en: Somehow just lookin' only makes me feel worse.
dialogue_jp: 眺めるたびに　みじめになるわ

dialogue_en: He looks just like you.
dialogue_jp: そっくりな従業員だな

dialogue_en: "...See what I have to deal with?"
dialogue_jp: ……というワケなんです

dialogue_en: Yeah, I hear ya. Could make any kinda tool you'd want─fix up just about anything─but, man, was he a pain to work with.
dialogue_jp:
サカキの爺さん
どんな道具も作っちまうし
大抵のもんは直せるから
ありがたいんだけどな

dialogue_en: It's no use. Wheel's busted. How're we supposed to move all these rations now?
dialogue_jp:
まいったな　車輪がイカれちまった
配給の食材を届けなきゃなんねえのに

dialogue_en: Makes me feel safe─like he's still here with me.
dialogue_jp:
きっといまでも
私のそばに居てくれるの

dialogue_en: His old gun's the only thing I've got left to remember him by.
dialogue_jp: 旦那の形見のこの銃は　私のお守り

dialogue_en: Been four years, and not a day goes by I don't think of my husband.
dialogue_jp:
魔晄炉事故のせいで
うちの人も亡くなったの

dialogue_en: Chirp chirp chirp!
dialogue_jp: ピヨピヨ～！

dialogue_en: Think my mom would let me keep him?
dialogue_jp: あの子　飼えるかな

dialogue_en: They're so cute!
dialogue_jp: かわいいね～

dialogue_en: Is that the mommy? And is that the baby!?
dialogue_jp: うわ～　鳥さん親子？

dialogue_en: And little did I know, I was in some of the best hands in the world.
dialogue_jp:
わしが元気なのは
先生の腕がいいんだろうな

dialogue_en: But it's doctors who do the operatin', not their equipment.
dialogue_jp: まあ　医療は機械がするもんじゃない

dialogue_en: This used to be a coal miners' clinic, see, and all the equipment was ancient as hell. Didn't trust it one bit. Reckoned I was done for.
dialogue_jp:
もとは炭坑の診療所だったらしいけど
古めかしい設備しかなくて
不安になったもんだ

dialogue_en: Found myself here when I woke up. Wasn't none too happy about that.
dialogue_jp:
ここに運びこまれたときには
おったまげたよ

dialogue_en: Got myself injured while working on the reactor back in the day.
dialogue_jp: 魔晄炉建設中に　ケガしてね

dialogue_en: Them and all the others are probably why he works so hard. His way of making up for all the lives he couldn't save that day.
dialogue_jp:
先生が村のために色々してくれるのは
家族を守れなかったことへの
罪滅ぼしなのかもな

dialogue_en: The doc was here when everything went down in Corel. Unfortunately, his family wasn't. Terrible shame.
dialogue_jp:
コレル村の事件のとき　先生は
ここで仕事をしていて難を逃れたけど
村にいたご家族は亡くなられて

dialogue_en: If there's one thing you can count on, it's Doctor Sheiran. He's been here since the old mining days.
dialogue_jp:
炭坑時代から
この診療所とシロン先生だけは変わらず
ここにありつづけてるんだ

dialogue_en: And it's working. Folks are looking healthier than ever!
dialogue_jp: お薬のおかげで　みんな健康なのよ

dialogue_en: Just between us, though, he's actually been mixing supplements into the meals.
dialogue_jp:
ここだけの話　配給のごはんに
お薬を入れてるの

dialogue_en: Doctor Sheiran's been distributing meals to the people in town. Says it's because he wants to keep them healthy and out of his clinic.
dialogue_jp:
シロン先生が食事の配給とかしてるのは
病人を減らして
楽したいからだって言ってたわ

dialogue_en: I wouldn't give up on the man just yet.
dialogue_jp:
生きてりゃ
いいことあるかもしれないしな

dialogue_en: I hear Dyne's been hangin' around the Dustbowl these days.
dialogue_jp:
ダインのやつ
いまはアンダーソーサーにいるらしい

dialogue_en: Hahhh... If only we'd listened to Dyne back then.
dialogue_jp: あの時　ダインに賛成してればな

dialogue_en: You a ninja?
dialogue_jp: 忍術の影響か

dialogue_en: You have a twin?
dialogue_jp: 双子だったのか

dialogue_en: Looking to make some quick gil? Then I have got some news for you, friends!
dialogue_jp:
儲け話　みなさんに
特別に教えちゃいます！

dialogue_en: Children of the planet, hearken to our mother. Open your heart and heed her mournful cries!
dialogue_jp:
星の民よ　いまこそ
星とつながり　星の叫びを聞け

dialogue_en: Please line up in an orderly fashion!
dialogue_jp: しっかり食べて　元気出しましょう

dialogue_en: Doc Sheiran made sure there's plenty to go around, so don't worry.
dialogue_jp:
たっぷりあるので　慌てず
順序よく並んでください

dialogue_en: Get your free rations!
dialogue_jp: シロン先生の配給で～す！

dialogue_en: I'll help with those too! Maybe if there's a broken one I can keep it?
dialogue_jp:
うん　それも手伝う
不良品があったらもらいたいな

dialogue_en: Oh, we got these keychains shaped like Dio's mustache now too. They're sure to sell.
dialogue_jp:
あっ　ディオの
ヒゲキーホルダーの金具付けも
はじめることにしたんだ

dialogue_en: Keep chewin', okay? It'll make you feel full.
dialogue_jp:
たくさん噛んでね
お腹いっぱいになるから

dialogue_en: You took everything from me!
dialogue_jp: あたしの家族を返して！

dialogue_en: What "glorious dream" ya come peddlin' now?
dialogue_jp:
村を捨てて
あんたは気楽なもんねえ

dialogue_en: Come to build us another reactor? First one was plenty!
dialogue_jp:
おいおい
また魔晄炉でも建てるのか？

dialogue_en: What─you gonna do some song an' dance 'bout how sorry you are?
dialogue_jp:
謝罪の歌でも歌えよ
鉱山でよく歌ってたろ

dialogue_en: But here I can see all my friends and acquaintances. It does an old lady good to get out and chew the fat.
dialogue_jp:
ここにくりゃ知り合いと会えるし
ありがたいよ

dialogue_en: If I stayed cooped up at home all the time, I'd die of boredom.
dialogue_jp: 家にいたら　退屈で死んじまいそうでね

dialogue_en: Why, I'm as spry as a spring chocobo thanks to him.
dialogue_jp:
おかげで　あたしゃ
こんなにピンピンよ

dialogue_en: The doctor here always knows just how to treat my aches and pains. He's such a dear.
dialogue_jp:
先生に診てもらえば
たいていの病気は　すぐに治るのよ

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: She knows your pain, your sadness, your grief. She knows your anger.
dialogue_jp:
残された者は　悲しみ　迷い
憎しみに囚われている

dialogue_en: Count me in!
dialogue_jp: いいねえ！

dialogue_en: Just say the word and I'll be more than happy to get you good folks set up.
dialogue_jp: お金なら　いつでもご用意しますよ

dialogue_en: For she suffers as you do. She too weeps for what she has lost.
dialogue_jp:
コレルは　かつて多くの星の民が
星に帰られた地

dialogue_en: You'll be able to pay it back in no time flat!
dialogue_jp:
すぐにもうかるから
返済も　すぐに終わります

dialogue_en: Easy as pie, right? Anyone can do it! And if you need a little something to get started, I can help you out with a small loan.
dialogue_jp:
どうです　簡単でしょう？
いますぐ借金してでも始めるべきです

dialogue_en: Once you've made a tidy sum, you can invest in even more and start raking in the gil!
dialogue_jp:
投資額をドーンとあげれば
儲けもドーンとあがります～！

dialogue_en: First, you buy up new orbs on the cheap: ones that are sure to prove valuable. Then, once their price skyrockets, you sell 'em for a huge profit!
dialogue_jp:
まず　確実に高騰する新作マテリアを
安く大量に買い付け
マテリアの値があがったら
一気に売りさばく

dialogue_en: All you need to do is invest in materia!
dialogue_jp: マテリア投資なら必ず儲かります

dialogue_en: No, no─shouldn't think like that. I should be thankful for all Doc Sheiran's done for us.
dialogue_jp:
ううん……
おいしいって思いながら食べなきゃ
シロン先生に悪いわ

dialogue_en: Can't even tell anymore if it's good or bad. It's just food.
dialogue_jp:
おいしいのか　まずいのかも
もうわからないのよ

dialogue_en: Same shit, different day.
dialogue_jp: 毎日　このごはん

dialogue_en: The lunches we got as miners were much better. Those were meals that put meat on your bones.
dialogue_jp:
炭坑でも　給食があったな
体が資本だからって豪勢だったよ

dialogue_en: Come! Raise your voice and join in our righteous chorus!
dialogue_jp:
身のうちにある星を見いだし
ともに響け

dialogue_en: So join in her lament! Share in her rage!
dialogue_jp: いまこそ　星を救うために行動せよ

dialogue_en: So how do we...invest?
dialogue_jp: 投資って　なにするの？

dialogue_en: This money'll give my kids a chance...
dialogue_jp: 子供の将来のために……

dialogue_en: Cushy life, here I come!
dialogue_jp: うんうん　儲かりそうね！

dialogue_en: Maybe I should get in on this.
dialogue_jp: 借りちゃおっかな～？

dialogue_en: Wow. Sounds like a cinch to pay off.
dialogue_jp: ふ～ん　すぐに返せるんだ

dialogue_en: Time to rake it in!
dialogue_jp: 『ドーン』か～！

dialogue_en: Could always book it if I can't pay.
dialogue_jp: 返せなかったら　逃げりゃいいか

dialogue_en: Don't fall for it.
dialogue_jp: だまされるな　オレ

dialogue_en: Think I'll take you up on that offer.
dialogue_jp: ぜひ　仕事を紹介してくれ

dialogue_en: Haha! Well, it's clear you've both got eyes for skill.
dialogue_jp:
俺の才能を見抜くとは
あんたたち　見る目あるな！

dialogue_en: Feels like this goddamn desert grows bigger every day. Maybe it'll swallow the whole world.
dialogue_jp:
砂漠がどんどん広がってる気がするけど
いつか世界が砂で覆われちまうのかもな

dialogue_en: Pff... Pff... Puh! Gotta love that dusting of sand on every drink.
dialogue_jp:
ぺっぺっ　ぺっ！
砂まじりの酒はここの名物だな

dialogue_en: I'd follow that princess to the ends of the world if she let me.
dialogue_jp:
あの人の言うことなら
なんでも聞いちゃうかも

dialogue_en: Can still smell her perfume. Wish I knew what it was.
dialogue_jp:
それに　とっても
いいにおいがするんだよね

dialogue_en: She wore these stunning red dresses, and the way she laughed...
dialogue_jp:
真っ赤なドレスがすてきで
冷たく笑うのよ

dialogue_en: Back when the reactor was being built, there was this Shinra exec: Scarlet. I'll never forget her.
dialogue_jp:
魔晄炉建設のときに村にきた
神羅のスカーレットさんが
忘れられないんだ

dialogue_en: For our mother's sake, and for ours. For what we do for the planet, we do for ourselves.
dialogue_jp:
そう　星を救うことは
わが身を救うことにほかならぬ

dialogue_en: I don't understand. How am I still hungry? Is there a hole in my stomach or something?
dialogue_jp:
ぜんぜん腹いっぱいにならない
オレの胃袋　穴でもあいてるのか

dialogue_en: Ten, twenty, thirty...
Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: Spar with Kid G?
dialogue_jp: キッドＧと戦いますか？

dialogue_en: And comic books, they ain't never lie!
dialogue_jp: なあ　これは真実だよな！

dialogue_en: But there's a whole series about the Cactuar King!
dialogue_jp:
でも『サボテン大王』ってマンガにも
書かれてるって

dialogue_en: Dumbass made that up definitely had heatstroke.
dialogue_jp:
そんなの
暑さにやられて見た幻覚だよ

dialogue_en: The treasure. The one that's guarded by a talkin' goblin, dancin' cactuars, and other weird shit.
dialogue_jp:
お宝って　しゃべるゴブリンだの
動きまわるサボデンダーが
守ってるってやつだろ？

dialogue_en: Least this way we got a shot at a better life!
dialogue_jp:
いっそ死んだつもりで
探しに行こうぜ

dialogue_en: Way I see it, wastin' away here ain't no better.
dialogue_jp:
ここでくすぶってたら
死んだも同然じゃねえか

dialogue_en: Hell no. I ain't dyin' in the desert lookin' for treasure that might not exist.
dialogue_jp:
あるかわからないお宝を探しに
砂漠をさまようなんて　絶対ゴメンだ

dialogue_en: We ain't gonna save you if you get heatstroke.
dialogue_jp: 暑さにやられて幻覚見るなよ？

dialogue_en: Wouldn't recommend going out there, 'less you got a death wish.
dialogue_jp: 砂漠に出たって　いいことないぜ？

dialogue_en: No one'll be able to treat us like dirt now.
dialogue_jp: もうプリズンで踏みつけられたくねえ

dialogue_en: Yeah, we got this in the bag.
dialogue_jp: おう　のしあがろうぜ！

dialogue_en: Keep 'em comin'. If we can haul in more suckers, we got a good chance at comin' out on top this month.
dialogue_jp:
もっと営業かけて　カモを集めよう
今月のＭＶＰをとってやる

dialogue_en: Right? They're so desperate for gil that they'll believe any bullshit ya feed 'em.
dialogue_jp:
困ってるヤツばっかだから
楽して稼げるって言えばすぐ釣れる

dialogue_en: Hahaha... Talk about easy marks. Guess I won't have to worry about meeting this month's quota.
dialogue_jp:
ヘヘヘ　いいカモがひっかかった
今月のノルマ達成　ちょろいな

dialogue_en: You got a deal! I'll tell my friends, family─everybody!
dialogue_jp:
友達も家族も親戚も
みーんな連れてくよ！

dialogue_en: We get all that? For free? Rich people're somethin' else.
dialogue_jp:
おお　金持ちのやることは
スケールが違うな

dialogue_en: I ain't done yet! I want a rematch!
dialogue_jp: まだまだ　もう１戦だ！

dialogue_en: You gonna hit me or what!?
dialogue_jp: やんのか　コラ！

dialogue_en: C'mon, bring it!
dialogue_jp: やってやらあ！

dialogue_en: Okay. I'll help put on the Dio stickers.
dialogue_jp:
うん　ディオシール貼り
手伝うね

dialogue_en: And we have to pack up these Dio Cookies.
dialogue_jp:
ディオクッキーの
袋詰めしなきゃならないのよ

dialogue_en: Pick up the pace. We need three hundred more.
dialogue_jp: 急いで　今日中にあと３００個！

dialogue_en: Guess so.
dialogue_jp: お……おう

dialogue_en: Shouldn't be too quick to trust friendly types, 'specially if they're "here to help."
dialogue_jp:
この村じゃあ　いいヤツはたいてい
悪いヤツだ　覚えとけ

dialogue_en: If it sounds too good to be true, it is.
dialogue_jp: 世の中　うまい話なんてないぜ

dialogue_en: Could be they got caught up in some shady business.
dialogue_jp:
あやしい商売に
手を出したんじゃないよな？

dialogue_en: That so? Y'know, I haven't seen or heard from this one friend in a while now...
dialogue_jp:
マジかよ　オレの親友も
なにも言わずにいなくなっちまったんだ

dialogue_en: And they always seem to poof right when things're lookin' up for 'em.
dialogue_jp:
消えるのは
羽振りが良くなったヤツばかりって話だ

dialogue_en: Been a lotta people up and vanishin' lately.
dialogue_jp: 最近　行方不明になるヤツらが多いな

dialogue_en: Hahaha... That's a little pearl o' wisdom I picked up.
dialogue_jp:
ハハハ　これが
生活の知恵ってやつよ

dialogue_en: Take it from me, even the foulest food'll taste halfway decent if you eat it somewhere nice.
dialogue_jp:
見晴らしがいいところで食えば
カスカスのメシも　すこしはマシになる

dialogue_en: Going...going...gone!
dialogue_jp: ガツーン　大当たり～！

dialogue_en: Hah, look down on us, will ya!?
dialogue_jp: 俺たちをナメやがって！

dialogue_en: You're in for it now!
dialogue_jp: こらしめてやるよ！

dialogue_en: I'm sorry... I'm sorry!
dialogue_jp: だまして……すんません

dialogue_en: Aah! Please, no more...
dialogue_jp: ひいい　もう許してくれ

dialogue_en: You're goin' down next time!
dialogue_jp: 次は負けねえぞ！

dialogue_en: Give 'em hell!
dialogue_jp: キレがないよ！

dialogue_en: Woo!
dialogue_jp: キャ～！

dialogue_en: Right there─get 'em!
dialogue_jp: ほら　そこだ！

dialogue_en: Keep 'em comin'!
dialogue_jp: もっとやれ！

dialogue_en: What are ya, chicken!?
dialogue_jp: ビビんなよ～！

dialogue_en: Hell yeah! That's what I like to see!
dialogue_jp: オラオラ　いけよ！

dialogue_en: Woo!
dialogue_jp: ヒュ～！

dialogue_en: Woo!
Woo!
Woo!
Woo!
Woo!
dialogue_jp: ヒュ～！

dialogue_en: Woohoo!
Woohoo!
Woohoo!
Woohoo!
Woohoo!
Woohoo!
Woohoo!
Woohoo!
Woohoo!
Woohoo!
dialogue_jp: おお～！

dialogue_en: Ugh...
dialogue_jp: ああ～……

dialogue_en: Got room to spare, but we can roll out whenever.
dialogue_jp:
いつでもかっさばいて
売り飛ばせます

dialogue_en: We already got 'em all rounded up in the truck. They ain't goin' nowhere.
dialogue_jp:
全員とっつかまえて
トラックに詰めこみました

dialogue_en: Just like you said it would!
dialogue_jp: 楽勝っす

dialogue_en: So, how's the investment squeeze comin'?
dialogue_jp: マテリア投資の取り立ては順調か？

dialogue_en: Haha... Not that outsiders can participate.
dialogue_jp: はは　よそ者は挑戦もできねえよ

dialogue_en: Barroom brawls've been a time-honored tradition since the minin' days.
dialogue_jp:
酒場の殴りあいは
炭坑時代からの恒例行事だ

dialogue_en: Huh... Ain't seen you before. Just so you know, outsiders ain't welcome here.
dialogue_jp:
ああ？　見ねえ顔だな
ここじゃ　よそ者は歓迎されねえぞ

dialogue_en: I suggest you drink your drink─or you find yourself another bar to patronize. Got me?
dialogue_jp:
明日からの行き先をなくしたくなけりゃ
出された酒を　おとなしく飲んでな

dialogue_en: Listen, man. I'm just asking for somethin' harder, y'know? Somethin' that'll knock my socks off!
dialogue_jp:
なあ　キッツイのくれよ
火をつけたら燃えあがるようなヤツをよ

dialogue_en: Don't like what I serve? Leave. And be sure to let the door hit your ass on your way out.
dialogue_jp:
文句があるなら出てけよ
それで　二度と店には来るな

dialogue_en: Hey...barkeep. You sure this shit's booze? 'Cause it tastes more like chocobo piss to me.
dialogue_jp:
はあ　ぜんぜん酔えねえよ
マスター　この酒ほとんど水だろ

dialogue_en: Woo!
Woo!
Woo!
Woo!
Woo!
Heh heh heh... You got it, Boss.
dialogue_jp: ヒヒヒ　楽勝っす！

dialogue_en: Well, if that's the case, then I say we squeeze in a few more.
dialogue_jp:
いいぞ　さらえるだけさらったら
ドロンだ

dialogue_en: Propeller good, ropes good! All clear!
dialogue_jp: プロペラよ～し　ロープよ～し！

dialogue_en: Wait, he wouldn't fire me, would he? A pay cut, sure, but...
dialogue_jp:
減給かな
まさか　クビはないよな？

dialogue_en: My boss is gonna rake me over the coals.
dialogue_jp: またリーダーに嫌味言われる

dialogue_en: Shit... Late again. I'm in for it now.
dialogue_jp: 終わった　またしても遅刻

dialogue_en: Though they're still squeezed out of damn near every last gil, I hear.
dialogue_jp:
まあ　給料は
しぼりとられてるらしいけどね

dialogue_en: The lucky people who get to work behind the scenes at the Gold Saucer─now those ones are the top earners.
dialogue_jp:
ゴールドソーサーの裏方で働ける連中は
ここじゃ超一流の仕事人だよ

dialogue_en: The pay is so good...and the work is even better.
dialogue_jp:
こんなに楽しくて
給料も……イイ

dialogue_en: Oh, if only I could stay like this forever. Forever and ever...
dialogue_jp:
イイぞ……
ああ　気持ちイイ……

dialogue_en: Need to get the goods from the Gold Saucer ready by the time the next gondola comes round, though.
dialogue_jp:
次の便までに　ゴールドソーサーで
調達してもらったもんを配る準備だ

dialogue_en: Glad to see everything's running smoothly today.
dialogue_jp: うんうん　今日も順調だな

dialogue_en: Daddy's not back yet. Is he, um, doing overtime again?
dialogue_jp:
パパ　帰ってこなかったね
また『ざんぎょう』？

dialogue_en: But this is my dream job. I'd never forgive myself if I lost it just 'cause I wanted a break.
dialogue_jp:
いいんだよ　夢の仕事なんだ
休みナシでも失いたくない

dialogue_en: But what about all the people who look forward to my show? I can't let them down.
dialogue_jp:
僕のショーを楽しみにくる
お客様のために　がんばらなきゃ！

dialogue_en: Safe and reliable! My head's got more loose screws than this thing!
dialogue_jp:
たまに頭のネジがはずれる
オレの整備だ　絶対安全だぜ！

dialogue_en: Step right up! This ropeway is your one-way ticket to a golden paradise!
dialogue_jp:
ゴールドソーサー行きロープウェイ
これに乗れば　いつでも黄金の楽園行き

dialogue_en: I was born for this job. Truly, I was! And nothing but death will ever keep me from it.
dialogue_jp:
これぞ天職……
ああ　やめられない～

dialogue_en: Attempt Cactuar Crush with <color=yellow>Yuffie</color>?
dialogue_jp:
『サボテン・ノック』に挑戦しますか？
【挑戦者：ユフィ】

dialogue_en: Wanna join me in Costa del Amor?
dialogue_jp:
コスタでアモール
いっしょに参加しない？

dialogue_en: I bet...
dialogue_jp: ダメです

dialogue_en: So soon after everything? I could use a night out─and a lotta drinks.
dialogue_jp:
船でいろいろあった後なんだ
今日くらいは酒を飲んでもいいだろ？

dialogue_en: Tomorrow morning, bright and early.
dialogue_jp: 明日の早朝ですね

dialogue_en: When do we set sail?
dialogue_jp: 次の出航はいつなの？

dialogue_en: Smell that? Love is in the air!
dialogue_jp: う～ん　恋の予感がする！

dialogue_en: Surf and sun, here I come!
dialogue_jp: バカンス　バカンス～

dialogue_en: The sun is shinin' and I'm ready to live it up!
dialogue_jp: 太陽がまぶしいっす　はじけるっす！

dialogue_en: Only way to beat this kinda heat is to go for a swim!
dialogue_jp:
あっちいな～
海に飛び込んで冷やすか

dialogue_en: The beach is calling my name!
dialogue_jp: ビーチが俺を呼んでるぜ！

dialogue_en: So is the president okay?
dialogue_jp: ルーファウスさんは大丈夫なの？

dialogue_en: And well-deserved, after what went down in Junon.
dialogue_jp: ジュノンの式典　大変だったみたいね

dialogue_en: Look: you're clearly incapable of helping. Put the manager on!
dialogue_jp:
おまえじゃ話にならん
責任者を出せ！

dialogue_en: For crying out loud, I just bought it!
dialogue_jp: そんなはずがあるから電話してんだよ

dialogue_en: Ugh... How many times do I have to tell you? The yacht you sold me is trash!
dialogue_jp:
だ～か～ら～！
おたくから買ったばかりのクルーザーが
壊れてんの

dialogue_en: Look, I just wanna black out for a bit!
dialogue_jp: 嫌なことを早く忘れたいんだよ

dialogue_en: And give you an excuse to hit the sauce? I don't think so.
dialogue_jp:
ナンパのフリして
お酒にありつこうって魂胆ですね

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: <button=mission> Hard Mode
dialogue_jp: <button=mission>ミッションモード

dialogue_en: Hard Mode
dialogue_jp: ミッションモード

dialogue_en: Normal Mode
dialogue_jp: ノーマルモード

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: Attempt Cactuar Crush with <color=yellow>Aerith</color>?
dialogue_jp:
『サボテン・ノック』に挑戦しますか？
【挑戦者：エアリス】

dialogue_en: Ugh... Easy there, ladies. Daddy's not goin' anywhere until his stomach settles.
dialogue_jp:
うう……はしゃがないでくれよ
船酔いのせいで　吐きそうなんだ

dialogue_en: C'mon, I wanna go to the beach already!
dialogue_jp: ねえねえ　早く海に行こうよ！

dialogue_en: God, it's so hot... I'm melting like a popsicle!
dialogue_jp:
ああ　あつ～い
ぜんぶ脱いじゃおうかな

dialogue_en: Or we could maybe check out something else...? Like, literally anything else!
dialogue_jp:
えっ　ええ～？
それより　ほかのところ行こうよ

dialogue_en: Uh, I... No idea!
dialogue_jp: えっ？　し……知らない

dialogue_en: What's this "Costa del Amor"?
dialogue_jp: コスタでアモールってなに？

dialogue_en: I'm just happy to be back on dry land.
dialogue_jp: はあ　無事到着してよかったよ

dialogue_en: Too much partying, not enough sleeping.
dialogue_jp: ふわ～あ　遊びすぎて寝不足

dialogue_en: Just need a quick shower, then it's time to beach out!
dialogue_jp:
シャワーを浴びたら
ビーチに遊びに行くんだ

dialogue_en: I've got my suit on, and I'm ready to go for a swim!
dialogue_jp: もう服の下に水着きてるんだよね

dialogue_en: I think I'll do a little shopping before I hit the beach!
dialogue_jp:
海より先に
まずはショッピングでしょ！

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: Ride to the Gold Saucer?
dialogue_jp: ゴールドソーサーへ向かいますか？

dialogue_en: Those guys've gotta be up to something...
dialogue_jp: 気味の悪い連中がいるな

dialogue_en: Was it a terror attack by Avalanche? Or maybe Wutai?
dialogue_jp:
昨日暴れたのはアバランチ？
それとも　ウータイ？

dialogue_en: Nothing kills the vibe like a bunch of uglies mucking up the beach.
dialogue_jp:
海にモンスターなんて
バカンスが台無しよ

dialogue_en: Hope I can enjoy the beach in peace today.
dialogue_jp:
今日はゆっくり
ビーチで泳げればいいんだが

dialogue_en: I came here to forget the woes of the world, but there's trouble even in paradise.
dialogue_jp:
コスタで過ごす休日くらいは
物騒な世の中のことは忘れたいよ

dialogue_en: You hear about that mess on the beach? Glad I wasn't there.
dialogue_jp:
昨日はビーチで
いろいろと騒ぎが起こったらしいな

dialogue_en: I wonder if I need to worry about monsters here too.
dialogue_jp:
コスタの海にも
モンスターがいるのかな

dialogue_en: Those monsters gave me such a fright, I couldn't sleep a wink.
dialogue_jp:
モンスター騒ぎのせいで
ぜんぜん眠れなかった

dialogue_en: You're never safe from fiends─not even in the middle of the ocean!
dialogue_jp:
まさか　船がモンスターに
襲われるとはな

dialogue_en: What's this I hear about an attack on the ship?
dialogue_jp:
昨日のモンスター騒ぎは
なんだったんだ？

dialogue_en: Where can I learn that cute dance they do here?
dialogue_jp: コスタのダンス　どこで習えますか？

dialogue_en: So where can I shoot some sweet selfies!?
dialogue_jp:
写真映えするスポットに
行きたいんですけど

dialogue_en: Do you know what time that tour guide is getting off work?
dialogue_jp:
スタッフのお姉さんは
今日　何時までお仕事？

dialogue_en: Our tour guide should've been here by now...
dialogue_jp: ツアーの迎えが　まだ来ないんだが

dialogue_en: You got a map of town?
dialogue_jp: 街の地図はないかな？

dialogue_en: I heard we should steer clear of those guys in black robes.
dialogue_jp:
黒マントには
近寄らないほうがいいって聞いたよ

dialogue_en: Those robes? Here? How gauche.
dialogue_jp: コスタに黒マントなんて　野暮よねえ

dialogue_en: Oh, c'mon. Don't tell me those guys are here on vacation.
dialogue_jp:
おいおい
黒マントもコスタでバカンスか？

dialogue_en: I am living for the vibes here.
dialogue_jp: キラキラ感　すごすぎ

dialogue_en: Make way for the Wheelie Master, everyone!
dialogue_jp: 最高のウィリー乗りがお通りよ！

dialogue_en: Any of these helpful ladies looking for a little "amor"?
dialogue_jp:
スタッフのお姉さんは
アモール探し　しないの？

dialogue_en: You're not just the master─you're a god on wheels!
dialogue_jp:
そのウィリーさばき
もはや神がかっているぞ！

dialogue_en: Whoa... I'm in the presence of the Wheelie Master!
dialogue_jp:
ウィウィウィ……
ウィリーマスターだよ！

dialogue_en: Hey there! When are you gonna take me for a ride on that thing?
dialogue_jp:
ねえ　そのウィリーで
どこでも連れてってよ！

dialogue_en: I'm on the hunt for new love, baby!
dialogue_jp: 新しい恋　見つけちゃお！

dialogue_en: I've never seen anyone ride so well. You're a wheelie wizard!
dialogue_jp: そのウィリーさばき　もはや達人だな

dialogue_en: Damn! You must know Costa del Sol like the back of your hand!
dialogue_jp:
おお　コスタの道の
すべてを知っている走りだ！

dialogue_en: Wow! I dunno how you keep your balance!
dialogue_jp: うわ　すごい上手なウィリー乗りね

dialogue_en: Where's the best place for a romantic dinner?
dialogue_jp: オススメのデートコースを教えてくれよ

dialogue_en: You're no amateur. I can definitely tell that much!
dialogue_jp:
そのウィリーさばき
素人ではないな

dialogue_en: I gotta say, you're pretty good with that thing!
dialogue_jp: おお　よく乗りこなしてるな

dialogue_en: Due to its enduring reputation for quality service, reservations must be made well in advance.
dialogue_jp:
伝統と格式に裏打ちされた
ホスピタリティを提供するホテルとして
高い評価を受けております

dialogue_en: Here we have one of our most luxurious hotels: the Costa del Sol Resort.
dialogue_jp:
こちらは　コスタでナンバーワンの
リゾートホテル
『コスタ・デル・ソル・リゾート』です

dialogue_en: It's a popular spot for celebrities and Shinra executives looking for an escape from the public eye.
dialogue_jp:
神羅の役員の方はもちろん
各界の著名人も　よく
